description: The appearance of IP-10 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

name: granzyme B production
description: The appearance of granzyme B due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

name: tumor necrosis factor superfamily cytokine production
description: The appearance of any member of the TNF superfamily due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

name: IgG immunoglobulin complex
description: A protein complex composed of two identical immunoglobulin heavy chains of an IgG isotype and two identical immunoglobulin light chains, held together by disulfide bonds. An IgG immunoglobulin complex may be embedded in the plasma membrane or present in the extracellular space, in mucosal areas or other tissues, or circulating in the blood or lymph.

name: IgE immunoglobulin complex
description: A protein complex composed of two identical immunoglobulin heavy chains of the IgE isotype and two identical immunoglobulin light chains, held together by disulfide bonds. An IgE immunoglobulin complex may be embedded in the plasma membrane or present in the extracellular space, in mucosal areas or other tissues, or circulating in the blood or lymph.

name: IgA immunoglobulin complex
description: A protein complex composed of two identical immunoglobulin heavy chains of the IgA isotype and two identical immunoglobulin light chains, held together by disulfide bonds, and sometimes complexed with J chain or J chain and secretory component. An IgA immunoglobulin complex may be embedded in the plasma membrane or present in the extracellular space, in mucosal areas or other tissues, or circulating in the blood or lymph.

name: IgM immunoglobulin complex
description: A protein complex composed of two identical immunoglobulin heavy chains of the IgM isotype and two identical immunoglobulin light chains, held together by disulfide bonds, and in its circulating form complexed with J chain in polymeric forms. An IgM immunoglobulin complex may be embedded in the plasma membrane or present in the extracellular space, in mucosal areas or other tissues, or circulating in the blood or lymph.

name: chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 production
description: The appearance of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 (CCL22) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

name: tumor necrosis factor (ligand) superfamily member 11 production
description: The appearance of tumor necrosis factor superfamily member 11 (TNFSF11; RANKL) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

name: interleukin-17A production
description: The appearance of interleukin-17A due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

name: interleukin-17F production
description: The appearance of interleukin-17F due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

name: complement-dependent cytotoxicity
description: Cell killing caused by the membrane attack complex formed following complement activation.

name: histamine secretion mediated by immunoglobulin
description: Histamine release triggered by the binding of an antigen to an immunoglobulin bound to the cell surface.

name: immune complex formation
description: The process that gives rise to an immune complex. Immune complexes are clusters of antibodies bound to antigen, to which complement may also be fixed, and which may precipitate or remain in solution. Examples are the clumping of cells such as bacteria or red blood cells in the presence of an antibody, precipitation of a toxin after an antibody binds to it, and clumping of viral particles as a result of antibody binding to the virus.

name: immunoglobulin-mediated neutralization
description: The inhibition of an antigen's biological effects by antibody binding to it. An example is neutralization of diphtheria toxin by preventing its entry into human cells via the binding of antibody specific for diphtheria toxin.

name: chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 19 production
description: The appearance of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 19 (CCL19) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

name: chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 21 production
description: The appearance of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 21 (CCL21) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

name: chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 12 production
description: The appearance of chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 12 (CXCL12) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

name: chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 13 production
description: The appearance of chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 13 (CXCL13) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

name: chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 16 production
description: The appearance of chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 16 (CXCL16) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

name: Insulin resistance
description: Increased resistance towards insulin, that is, diminished effectiveness of insulin in reducing blood glucose levels.

name: conditional specification
description: A directive information entity that specifies what should happen if the trigger condition is fulfilled.

name: measurement unit label
description: A measurement unit label is as a label that is part of a scalar measurement datum and denotes a unit of measure.

name: objective specification
description: A directive information entity that describes an intended process endpoint. When part of a plan specification the concretization is realized in a planned process in which the bearer tries to effect the world so that the process endpoint is achieved.

name: narrative object
description: A narrative object is an information content entity that is a set of propositions.

name: action specification
description: A directive information entity that describes an action the bearer will take.

name: datum label
description: A label is a symbol that is part of some other datum and is used to either partially define  the denotation of that datum or to provide a means for identifying the datum as a member of the set of data with the same label

name: software
description: Software is a plan specification composed of a series of instructions that can be  interpreted by or directly executed by a processing unit.

name: obsolete2_digital entity
description: A digital entity is an information entity which is a collection of bits that can be interpreted by a computer. Two digital entities are the same if they are bitwise identical.

name: journal article
description: A report that is published in a journal.

name: information carrier
description: A quality of an information bearer that imparts the information content

name: model number
description: A model number is an information content entity specifically borne by catalogs, design specifications, advertising materials, inventory systems and similar  that is about manufactured objects of the same class. The model number is an alternative term for the class. The manufactered objects may or may not also bear the model number. Model numbers can be encoded in a variety of other information objects, such as bar codes, numerals, or patterns of dots.

name: obsolete2_binary digital entity
description: A binary digital entity is a digital entity that is encoded in a way that is not easily human readable and that contains other than text characters.

name: obsolete_unit of measure
description: a unit of measure is the quality of some material entity compared to which another quality is some multiple of.

name: programming language
description: A language in which source code is written that is intended to be executed/run by a software interpreter. Programming languages are ways to write instructions that specify what to do, and sometimes, how to do it.

name: data item
description: An information content entity that is intended to be a truthful statement about something (modulo, e.g., measurement precision or other systematic errors) and is constructed/acquired by a method which reliably tends to produce (approximately) truthful statements.

name: symbol
description: An information content entity that is a mark(s) or character(s) used as a conventional representation of another entity.

name: numeral
description: A symbol that denotes a number.

name: information content entity
description: A generically dependent continuant that is about some thing.

name: integer numeral
description: A numeral that denotes an integer

name: scalar measurement datum
description: A scalar measurement datum is a measurement datum that is composed of two parts, numerals and a unit label.

name: directive information entity
description: An information content entity whose concretizations indicate to their bearer how to realize them in a process.

name: obsolete_study interpretation
description: A study interpretation is a textual entity about the implications of a study result. Examples include discussion of whether a hypothesis is false, whether the study failed to address the hypothesis, and whether the study results have led to new hypotheses

name: dot plot
description: A dot plot is a report graph which is a graphical representation of data where each data point is represented by a single dot placed on coordinates corresponding to data point values in particular dimensions.

name: graph
description: A diagram that presents one or more tuples of information by mapping those tuples in to a two dimensional space in a non arbitrary way.

name: obsolete2_text based digital entity
description: A text based digital entity is a digital entity that is encoded so that it only contains text characters.

name: rule
description: A rule is an executable which guides, defines, restricts actions.

name: obsolete2_report figure
description: A report figure is a report display element that has some aspect of illustration, but may be a composite of figures, images, and other elements

name: algorithm
description: A plan specification which describes the inputs and output of mathematical functions as well as workflow of execution for achieving an predefined objective. Algorithms are realized usually by means of implementation as computer programs for execution by automata.

name: software interpreter
description: A software interpreter is a software application that executes some specified input software.

name: curation status specification
description: The curation status of the term. The allowed values come from an enumerated list of predefined terms. See the specification of these instances for more detailed definitions of each enumerated value.

name: density plot
description: A density plot is a report graph which is a graphical representation of data where the tint of a particular pixel corresponds to some kind of function corresponding the the amount of data points relativelly with their distance from the the pixel.

name: report
description: A document assembled by an author for the purpose of providing information for the audience. A report is the output of a documenting process and has the objective to be consumed by a specific audience. Topic of the report is on something that has completed. A report is not a single figure. Examples of reports are journal article, patent application, grant progress report, case report (not patient record).

name: obsolete_report element
description: A report element is a narrative object in which information is presented and consumed by a human being, and is part of a report. Examples of report elements are figure (dot plot), table, text portion (may include a movie or audio clip on a web page).

name: obsolete2_binary executable
description: Binary executable is a digital entity consisting of the binary representation of machine instructions of a specific processor or they may be binary pseudocode for a virtual machine. A non-source executable file is also called an object program. It is assumed that the binary executable file contains properly-formatted computer instructions.  (derived from Wikipedia, Nov 1, 2007)

name: source code module
description: A source code module is a directive information entity that specifies, using a programming language, some algorithm.

name: obsolete_report table
description: A report table is a report display element consisting of a matrix of cells layed out in a grid, some set of which are filled with some information content

name: data format specification
description: A data format specification is the information content borne by the document published defining the specification. Example: The ISO document specifying what encompasses an XML document; The instructions in a XSD file

name: data set
description: A data item that is an aggregate of other data items of the same type that have something in common. Averages and distributions can be determined for data sets.

name: image
description: An image is an affine projection to a two dimensional surface, of measurements of some quality of an entity or entities repeated at regular intervals across a spatial range, where the measurements are represented as color and luminosity on the projected on surface.

name: data about an ontology part
description: Data about an ontology part is a data item about a part of an ontology, for example a term

name: plan specification
description: A directive information entity with action specifications and objective specifications as parts that, when concretized, is realized in a process in which the bearer tries to achieve the objectives by taking the actions specified.

name: obsolete2_digital document
description: A digital document is a digital entity consisting of an electronic file which can be rendered into human-readable form by one or more computational applications.  The digital document does not refer to the information content of the document but to an instance of the file.

name: measurement datum
description: A measurement datum is an information content entity that is a recording of the output of a measurement such as produced by a device.

name: version number
description: A version number is an information content entity which is a sequence of characters borne by part of each of a class of manufactured products or its packaging and indicates its order within a set of other products having the same name.

name: serial number
description: A serial number is an information content entity which is a unique sequence of characters borne by part of manufactured product or its packaging that is assigned to each individual in some class of products, and so can serve as a way to identify an individual product within the class. Serial numbers can be encoded in a variety of other information objects, such as bar codes, numerals, or patterns of dots.

name: lot number
description: A lot number is an information content entity which is an identical sequence of character borne by part of manufactured product or its packaging for each instances of a product class in a discrete batch of an item. Lot numbers are usually assigned to each separate production run of an item. Manufacturing as a lot might be due to a variety of reasons, for example,  a single process during which many individuals are made from the same portion of source material. Lot numbers can be encoded in a pattern  of other information objects, such as bar codes, numerals, or patterns of dots.

name: setting datum
description: A settings datum is a datum that denotes some configuration of an instrument.

name: conclusion textual entity
description: A textual entity that expresses the results of reasoning about a problem, for instance as typically found towards the end of scientific papers.

name: material information bearer
description: A material entity in which a concretization of an information content entity inheres.

name: histogram
description: A histogram is a report graph which is a statistical description of a distribution in terms of occurrence frequencies of different event classes.

name: heatmap
description: A heatmap is a report graph which is a graphical representation of data where the values taken by a variable(s) are shown as colors in a two-dimensional map.

name: Venn diagram
description: A Venn diagram is a report graph showing all hypothetically possible logical relations between a finite collection of sets.

name: obsolete_survival curve
description: A survival curve is a report graph which is a graphical representation of data where the percentage of survival is plotted as a function of time.

name: dendrogram
description: A dendrogram is a report graph which is a tree diagram frequently used to illustrate the arrangement of the clusters produced by a clustering algorithm.

name: scatter plot
description: A scatterplot is a graph which uses Cartesian coordinates to display values for two variables for a set of data. The data is displayed as a collection of points, each having the value of one variable determining the position on the horizontal axis and the value of the other variable determining the position on the vertical axis.

name: photograph
description: A photograph is created by projecting an image onto a photosensitive surface such as a chemically treated plate or film, CCD receptor, etc.

name: photographic print
description: A photographic print is a material entity upon which a photograph generically depends.

name: obsolescence reason specification
description: The reason for which a term has been deprecated. The allowed values come from an enumerated list of predefined terms. See the specification of these instances for more detailed definitions of each enumerated value.

name: textual entity
description: A textual entity is a part of a manifestation (FRBR sense), a generically dependent continuant whose concretizations are patterns of glyphs intended to be interpreted as words, formulas, etc.

name: citation
description: A textual entity intended to identify a particular publication.

name: author identification
description: A textual entity intended to identify a particular author

name: institutional identification
description: A textual entity intended to identify a particular institution

name: caption
description: A textual entity that describes a figure

name: document title
description: A textual entity that names a document

name: table
description: A textual entity that contains a two-dimensional arrangement of texts repeated at regular intervals across a spatial range, such that the spatial relationships among the constituent texts expresses propositions

name: table of abbreviations
description: A table where the constituent texts are abbreviations and their expansions

name: figure
description: An information content entity consisting of a two dimensional arrangement of information content entities such that the arrangement itself is about something.

name: diagram
description: A figure that expresses one or more propositions

name: document
description: A collection of information content entities intended to be understood together as a whole

name: publication
description: A document that has been accepted by a publisher

name: publication about an investigation
description: A publication that is about an investigation

name: patent
description: A document that has been accepted by a patent authority

name: document part
description: An information content entity that is part of a document.

name: abstract
description: A summary of the entire document that is substantially smaller than the document it summarizes.  It is about the document it summarizes.

name: introduction to a publication about an investigation
description: A part of a publication about an investigation that is about the objective specification (why the investigation is being done)

name: methods section
description: A part of a publication about an investigation that is about the study design of the investigation

name: results section
description: A part of a publication about an investigation that is about a study design execution

name: discussion section of a publication about an investigation
description: A part of a publication about an investigation that is about the study interpretation of the investigation

name: references section
description: A part of a document that has citations as parts

name: author list
description: A part of a document that enumerates the authors of the document

name: institution list
description: A part of a document that has parts that are institution identifications associated with the authors of the document

name: author contributions section
description: A part of a publication that is about the specific contributions of each author

name: acknowledgements section
description: Part of a publication that is about the contributions of people or institutions other than the authors.

name: footnote
description: A part of a document that is about a specific other part of the document.  Usually footnotes are spatially segregated from the rest of the document.

name: supplementary material to a document
description: A part of a document that is segregated from the rest of the document due to its size

name: table of contents
description: A table that relates document parts to specific locations in a document (usually page numbers).  This is also a document part (subsumption there should be inferred).

name: table of figures
description: A table that relates figures in a document to specific locations in that document (usually page numbers).  This is also a document part (subsumption there should be inferred).

name: running title
description: A shorter version of a document title

name: copyright section
description: A document part that describes  legal restrictions on making or distributing copies of the document

name: cartesian spatial coordinate datum
description: A cartesian spatial coordinate datum is a representation of a point in a spatial region, in which equal changes in the magnitude of a coordinate value denote length qualities with the same magnitude

name: one dimensional cartesian spatial coordinate datum
description: A cartesion spatial coordinate datum that  uses one value to specify a position along a one dimensional spatial region

name: two dimensional cartesian spatial coordinate datum
description: A cartesion spatial coordinate datum that  uses two values to specify a position within a two dimensional spatial region

name: three dimensional cartesian spatial coordinate datum
description: A cartesion spatial coordinate datum that  uses three values to specify a position within a three dimensional spatial region

name: length measurement datum
description: A scalar measurement datum that is the result of measurement of length quality

name: denotator type
description: A denotator type indicates how a term should be interpreted from an ontological perspective.

name: mass measurement datum
description: A scalar measurement datum that is the result of measurement of mass quality

name: hypothesis textual entity
description: A textual entity that expresses an assertion that is intended to be tested.

name: time measurement datum
description: A scalar measurement datum that is the result of measuring a temporal interval

name: postal address
description: A textual entity that is used as directive to deliver something to a person, or organization

name: author role
description: A role inhering in a person or organization that is realized when the bearer participates in the work which is the basis of the document, in the writing of the document, and signs it with their name.

name: data item extraction from journal article
description: A planned process in which journal articles are read or processed and data items are extracted, typically for further analysis or indexing

name: documenting
description: A planned process in which a document is created or added to by including the specified input in it.

name: line graph
description: A line graph is a type of graph created by connecting a series of data points together with a line.

name: assigning a centrally registered identifier
description: A planned process in which a new CRID is created, associated with an entity, and stored in the CRID registry thereby registering it as being associated with some entity

name: associating information with a centrally registered identifier in its registry
description: A planned process in which a CRID registry associates an information content entity with a CRID symbol
synonyms: ["associating information with a CRID in the CRID registry"]

name: obsolete_establishing a CRID registry
description: a planned process with the objective to establish a system that allows to refer to specific entities of a certain kind and store information about them, by establishing a CRID registry and plan specifications for the process of 1) assigning a CRID and 2) looking up a CRID.

name: centrally registered identifier symbol
description: A symbol that is part of a CRID and that is sufficient to look up a record from the CRID's registry.

name: centrally registered identifier
description: An information content entity that consists of a CRID symbol and additional information about the CRID registry to which it belongs.

name: centrally registered identifier registry
description: A CRID registry is a dataset of CRID records, each consisting of a CRID symbol and additional information which was recorded in the dataset through a assigning a centrally registered identifier process.

name: looking up a centrally registered identifier
description: A planned process in which a request to a CRID registry is made to return the information associated with a CRID symbol

name: time sampled measurement data set
description: A data set that is an aggregate of data recording some measurement at a number of time points. The time series data set is an ordered list of pairs of time measurement data and the corresponding measurement data acquired at that time.

name: written name
description: A textual entity that denotes a particular in reality.

name: software method
description: A software method (also called subroutine, subprogram, procedure, method, function, or routine) is software designed to execute a specific task.

name: software module
description: A software module is software composed of a collection of software methods.

name: software library
description: A software library is software composed of a collection of software modules and/or software methods in a form that can be statically or dynamically linked to some software application.

name: software application
description: A software application is software that can be directly executed by some processing unit.

name: software script
description: A software script is software whose instructions can be executed using a software interpreter.

name: abbreviation textual entity
description: A textual entity listing abbreviations and their expansions that are used in a document.

name: abbreviations section
description: A part of a document where abbreviations and their long-forms used within the document are listed.
synonyms: ["abbreviations","abbreviations list","abbreviations used","list of abbreviations","list of abbreviations used"]

name: author information section
description: A part of a document about the authors that provides biographical information and may discuss how the authors' professional experiences are relevant to the work described in the document.

name: author information textual entity
description: A textual entity expression information about an author of a document. This information may include biographical information and may discuss how the authors' professional experiences are relevant to the work described in the document.

name: author summary section
description: A part of a document, distinct from the abstract, that describes the significance and broader context of the document content. The author summary is often written in a non-technical manner and is aimed at both scientists and non-scientist readers.

name: author summary textual entity
description: A textual entity, distinct from the abstract, that describes the significance and broader context of the document content. The author summary is often written in a non-technical manner and is aimed at both scientists and non-scientist readers, e.g as described in the article submission guidelines for PLoS Genetics (http://journals.plos.org/plosgenetics/s/submission-guidelines).

name: availability section
description: A part of a document about a resource described in the document, e.g. software, that describes where and/or how that resource can be obtained.

name: availability textual entity
description: A textual entity expressing the location of a resource, e.g. software, or the manner in which a resource can be obtained.

name: case report section
description: A part of a document about the medical history of a specific patient as it relates to the topic of the document.

name: case report textual entity
description: A textual entity that expresses a detailed account of a portion of the medical history for a specific patient.

name: conclusion section
description: A part of a document used to summarize the findings discussed in the document. The conclusion section is typically found near the end of a document.

name: conflict of interest section
description: A part of a document used to declare any competing interests regarding the authors and/or funding organization for the work described in the document.
synonyms: ["competing interests","conflict of interest","conflict of interest statement","declaration of competing interests","disclosure of potential conflicts of interest"]

name: conflict of interest textual entity
description: A textual entity that expresses a situation involving one or more of the authors, or the funding source of a document whereby the authors or funding source stand to potentially gain (typically financially) from the results reported in the document.

name: consent section
description: A part of a document about the consent process that was used to enroll patients in a study.

name: consent textual entity
description: A textual entity that documents the consenting process used to enroll patients in a study.

name: ethical approval section
description: A part of a document about the governance body responsible for approving the work discussed in a document on an ethical basis.

name: ethical approval textual entity
description: A textual entity that documents the ethical approval of some study design.

name: figures section
description: A part of a document that contains one or more figures.

name: funding source declaration section
description: A part of a document used to detail information regarding the source of funding used in support of the generation of the document content.
synonyms: ["funding","funding information","funding sources","funding statement","funding/support","source of funding","sources of funding"]

name: funding source declaration textual entity
description: A textual entity documenting the source of funding that supported some study.

name: future directions section
description: A part of a document detailing extensions of the described work that may be implemented at some future point in time.
synonyms: ["future challenges","future considerations","future developments","future directions","future outlook","future perspectives","future plans","future prospects","future research","future research directions","future studies","future work"]

name: future directions textual entity
description: A textual entity expressing ideas regarding future work relevant to work described in a document that could be done.

name: genome announcement section
description: A document part announcing the publication of a novel draft genome sequence.

name: genome announcement textual entity
description: A textual entity that describes the generation and public release of a novel, draft genome sequence.

name: keyword textual entity
description: A textual entity listing keywords indicating the major theme(s) of a document.

name: keywords section
description: A part of a document where keywords selected by the author to categorize the major theme(s) of a document are listed.

name: study limitations section
description: A part of a document about biases or short comings related to the study design and execution.

name: study limitations textual entity
description: A textual entity addressing a shortcoming or bias of a study design or execution.

name: materials section
description: A part of a document about the materials required to reproduce the content of the document.

name: notes section
description: A part of a document containing typically short notes about the document itself and/or the authors. Often the notes section contains subsections related to funding, competing interests, ethical approval, etc.

name: patients section
description: A part of a document about the patients that participated in a study.

name: patients textual entity
description: A textual entity expressing information regarding the patients used in a study.

name: pre-publication history section
description: A part of the document about the publication history of a document. This section typically details dates of document submission to a journal and dates of any re-submissions as well as reviewer comments and responses to reviewers by the authors.

name: pre-publication history textual entity
description: A textual entity that expresses the pre-publication history (submission dates, reviewer comments, etc) for a document, often including a hyperlink to a web page detailing the information.

name: related work section
description: A part of a document about work in other publications that is relevant to the content of the document.

name: related work textual entity
description: A textual entity that discusses work from other publications and expresses their relevancy to the content of a document.

name: requirements section
description: A part of a document about a resource described in the document, e.g. software, that describes the requirements necessary to use the resource, e.g. operating systems, hardware, etc. in the case of a software resource.

name: requirements textual entity
description: A textual entity that expresses the requirements necessary to use a resource, e.g. software.

name: statistical analysis textual entity
description: A textual entity documenting statistical analysis tools and techniques employed.

name: statistical analysis section
description: A part of the document used to describe the statistical methodologies employed in the work presented in the document.

name: tables section
description: A part of a document that contains one or more tables.

name: postal code
description: An identifier that denotes some postal delivery route, some aggregate of postal delivery routes or a geographical region and was created for the purpose of sorting and delivering mail.

name: Postal delivery route
description: A plan specification that if realized, is realized by the delivery of mail to some facility or mailbox within some geographical region.

name: zone improvement plan code
description: A postal code that is used in the United States for the purpose of sorting and delivering mail, and that denotes some postal delivery route or some aggregate of postal delivery routes.

name: database extract, transform, and load process
description: A planned process which takes as input a database and fills another database by extracting concretizations of information entities from the first, transforming them, and loading the transformed concretizations into the second.

name: identifier
description: An identifier is an information content entity that is the outcome of a dubbing process and is used to refer to one instance of entity shared by a group of people to refer to that individual entity.

name: base ontology module
description: An ontology module that comprises only of asserted axioms local to the ontology, excludes import directives, and excludes axioms or declarations from external ontologies.

name: editors ontology module
description: An ontology module that is intended to be directly edited, typically managed in source control, and typically not intended for direct consumption by end-users.

name: main release ontology module
description: An ontology module that is intended to be the primary release product and the one consumed by the majority of tools.

name: bridge ontology module
description: An ontology module that consists entirely of axioms that connect or bridge two distinct ontology modules. For example, the Uberon-to-ZFA bridge module.

name: import ontology module
description: A subset ontology module that is intended to be imported from another ontology.

name: subset ontology module
description: An ontology module that is extracted from a main ontology module and includes only a subset of entities or axioms.

name: curation subset ontology module
description: A subset ontology that is intended as a whitelist for curators using the ontology. Such a subset will exclude classes that curators should not use for curation.

name: analysis subset ontology module
description: An ontology module that is intended for usage in analysis or discovery applications.

name: single layer subset ontology module
description: A subset ontology that is largely comprised of a single layer or strata in an ontology class hierarchy. The purpose is typically for rolling up for visualization. The classes in the layer need not be disjoint.

name: exclusion subset ontology module
description: A subset of an ontology that is intended to be excluded for some purpose. For example, a blacklist of classes.

name: external import ontology module
description: An imported ontology module that is derived from an external ontology. Derivation methods include the OWLAPI SLME approach.

name: species subset ontology module
description: A subset ontology that is crafted to either include or exclude a taxonomic grouping of species.

name: reasoned ontology module
description: An ontology module that contains axioms generated by a reasoner. The generated axioms are typically direct SubClassOf axioms, but other possibilities are available.

name: generated ontology module
description: An ontology module that is automatically generated, for example via a SPARQL query or via template and a CSV.

name: template generated ontology module
description: An ontology module that is automatically generated from a template specification and fillers for slots in that template.

name: obo basic subset ontology module
description: A subset ontology that is designed for basic applications to continue to make certain simplifying assumptions; many of these simplifying assumptions were based on the initial version of the Gene Ontology, and have become enshrined in many popular and useful tools such as term enrichment tools.  Examples of such assumptions include: traversing the ontology graph ignoring relationship types using a naive algorithm will not lead to cycles (i.e. the ontology is a DAG); every referenced term is declared in the ontology (i.e. there are no dangling clauses).  An ontology is OBO Basic if and only if it has the following characteristics: DAG Unidirectional No Dangling Clauses Fully Asserted Fully Labeled No equivalence axioms Singly labeled edges No qualifier lists No disjointness axioms No owl-axioms header No imports

name: ontology module subsetted by OWL profile
pathogenic disposition
description: A disposition to initiate processes that result in a disorder.

name: pathogen
description: A material entity with a pathogenic disposition.

name: infection
description: A part of an extended organism that itself has as part a population of one or more infectious agents and that (1) exists as a result of processes initiated by members of the infectious agent population and is (2) clinically abnormal in virtue of the presence of this infectious agent population, or (3) has a disposition to bring clinical abnormality to immunocompetent organisms of the same Species as the host (the organism corresponding to the extended organism) through transmission of a member or offspring of a member of the infectious agent population.

name: human pathogenicity disposition
description: A disposition to initiate processes that result in a disorder in a human organism.

name: role of being consumer safety officer
description: the role of a human being that is realized by enforcing regulations to ensure consumer safety

name: fluorescent reporter intensity
description: A measurement datum that represents the output of a scanner measuring the intensity value for each fluorescent reporter.

name: planned process
description: A process that realizes a plan which is the concretization of a plan specification.

name: regulator role
description: a regulatory role involved with making and/or enforcing relevant legislation and governmental orders

name: biological feature identification objective
description: Biological_feature_identification_objective is an objective role carried out by the proposition defining the aim of a study designed to examine or characterize a particular biological feature.

name: regulation-assigned role
description: Regulation-assigned role is a regulatory role defined by legislation or governmental orders

name: regulatory role
description: a role which inheres in material entities and is realized in the processes of making, enforcing or being defined by legislation or orders issued by a governmental body.

name: material supplier role
description: a role realized through the process of supplying materials such as animal subjects, reagents or other materials used in an investigation.

name: contract research organization role
description: a worker role of carrying out the study according to the protocol document or study plan delivered by the PI, under the control of the study director.  This role cannot make decisions about the study execution

name: list-mode data file
description: A list-mode data file is a binary digital entity where events are stored sequentially, parameter by parameter.

name: classified data set
description: A data set that is produced as the output of a class prediction data transformation and consists of a data set with assigned class labels.

name: reference substance role
description: a role inhering in a material entity that is realized when  characteristics or responses elicited by the substance are used for comparison or reference.

name: cytological stain role
description: A dye role that is realized when the stain is used to colour cells and or cellular components for the purposes of visualization

name: centrifuge pellet role
description: pellet role is a role which inheres in a material entity and is realized by a material separation process using gravitational force generated by a centrifuge in which the material bearing the pellet role is the heavier or heaviest component of the output material..

name: clinical research coordinator role
description: a worker role comprised of handling the administrative duties of a trial or study.

name: supernatant role
description: supernatant role is a role which inheres in a material entity and is realized by a material separation process using gravitational force in which the material bearing the supernatant role is the liquid component of the output material.

name: chromatography column
description: Chromatography column in chemistry is a tube and contents (typically glass) used to purify individual chemical compounds from mixtures of compounds. It is often used for preparative applications on scales from micrograms up to kilograms.

name: drug role
description: a role borne by a molecular entity and is realized in a process of absorption by an organism  alters, or effects  (or is assumed to effect) a function(s) which inhere in an organism

name: pump valve switch
description: A pump valve switch is a cardinal part of a liquid chromatography instrument that controls the flow.

name: xenotransplantation
description: is the transplantation of living cells, tissues or \ organs from one species to another such as from pigs to humans

name: physical document
description: A physical document is an object serving as a record of information by means of symbolic marks.

name: waiting
description: not actively doing anything to a material for a duration of time.

name: processed material
description: Is a material entity that is created or changed during material processing.

name: chromatography device
description: A device that facilitates the separation of mixtures. The function of a chromatography device involves passing a mixture dissolved in a \"\"mobile phase\"\" through a stationary phase, which separates the analyte to be measured from other molecules in the mixture and allows it to be isolated.

name: mass spectrometer
description: A mass spectrometer is an instrument which is used to measure the mass to charge ratio of ions. All mass spectrometers consist of three basic parts: an ion source, a mass analyzer, and a detector system. The stages within the mass spectrometer are: 1. Production of ions from the sample 2. Separation of ions with different masses 3. Detection of the number of ions of each mass produced 4.Collection of data to generate the mass spectrum

name: obsolete_platform
description: A platform is an object_aggregate that is the set of instruments and software needed to perform a process. definition_source: OBI.

name: liquid chromatography mass spectrometry platform
description: A liquid chromatography mass spectrometry platform is a platform that is the collection of instrument, software and reagents needed to perform a liquid chromatography mass spectrometry protocol. definition_source: OBI.

name: microarray platform
description: A microarray platform is a platform that contains the instruments, software and reagents needed to perform a microarray protocol. definition_source: OBI.

name: ratio of collected to emitted light
description: A measurement datum measuring the amount of light collected s compared to the total amount of emitted light in the detector component of a flow cytometer instrument. The datum has a qualitative role

name: software optimization objective
description: Software_optimization is a software_testing_objective role describing a study designed to identify the best software or parameters of the software.

name: notified body role
description: Notified body is regulator of consumables and medical devices charged by the Competent Authority with verifying compliance of medical devices (not drugs) with the applicable Essential Requirements stated in the Medical Device Directive

name: allotransplantation
description: is the transplantation of organs between members of the same species.

name: gamma counter
description: A processed material which measures gamma radiation

name: trial monitor role
description: a responsible party involved in planning, overseeing the conduct of a study or study component, and interpreting data from a study

name: positive reference substance role
description: a reference role in which the characteristics or responses elicited by the substance playing the reference substance role are used to establish a \"100%\" response

name: polyethylene glycol p-(1,1,3,3-tetramethylbutyl)-phenyl ether
description: triton X100 is a chemical entity which belongs to the group of The pluronics which are triblock copolymers of ethylene oxide and propylene oxide. Triton x-100 is_used_as detergent due to its non-ionic surfactant properties

name: investigation
description: a planned process that consists of parts: planning, study design execution, documentation and which produce conclusion(s).

name: evaluant role
description: a role that inheres in a material entity that is realized in an assay in which data is generated about the bearer of the evaluant role

name: reporting party role
description: a study personnel role played by a party who reports the outcome of a study component

name: assay
description: A planned process with the objective to produce information about the material entity that is the evaluant, by physically examining it or its proxies.

name: quantitative confidence value
description: A data item which is used to indicate the degree of uncertainty about a measurement.

name: sample preparation for assay
description: A sample_preparation_for_assay is a protocol_application including material_enrollments and biomaterial_transformations. definition_source: OBI.

name: diagnosis textual entity
description: diagnosis is an assessment of a disease or injury, its likely prognosis and treatment.

name: unplanned occurrence effecting an investigation
description: a process which is external in origin to the investigation that has an impact on the outcome.

name: eMedical record
description: An eMedical record is a digital document derived from a computer system used primarily for patient care in a clinical setting.  Not required to be compliant with requirements of 21 CFR Part 11.

name: culture medium
description: a processed material that provides the needed nourishment for microorganisms or cells grown in vitro.

name: electronic case report tabulation
description: An electronic case report tabulation is a digital document containing tabular data about multiple trial participants which is part of a clinical regulatory submission.  An eCRT has the property that it can be audited and compliant with requirements of 21 CFR Part 11  and has format suited to review by regulators.

name: polystyrene tube
description: A polystyrene tube is a test tube made of polystyrene

name: reagent role
description: A role inhering in a biological or chemical entity that is intended to be applied in a scientific technique to participate (or have molecular components that participate) in a chemical reaction that facilitates the generation of data about some entity distinct from the bearer, or the generation of some specified material output distinct from the bearer.

name: role of regulator of chemical manufacturer
description: a regulator involved with making and enforcing legislation and governmental orders relevant to chemical manufacture

name: detector reagent role
description: a role which inheres in a molecular entity and is realized by the process of recording or registering a stimulus.

name: role of certified IRB professional
description: a role of which inheres in a Homo sapiens and realized during administration and oversight of the daily activities of Institutional Review Boards (IRBs) in the USA

name: patient role
description: a role which inheres in a person and is realized by the process of being under the care of a physician or health care provider

name: material processing
description: A planned process which results in physical changes in a specified input material

name: protocol testing objective
description: Protocol_testing_objective is a methodology_testing_objective role describing a study designed to examine the effects of using different protocols.

name: participant under investigation role
description: A role that is realized through the execution of a study design in which the bearer of the role participates and in which data about that bearer is collected.

name: obsolete_role of being first subject treated
description: First subject treated role is a study subject role borne by the subject realized in the application of the process specified in intervention study design with no previous study subject realizing the role prior in the study

name: measured expression level
description: A measurement datum that is the outcome of the quantification of an assay for the activity of a gene, or the number of RNA transcripts.

name: responsible party role
description: a study personnel role played by a party who is accountable for the execution of a study component and can make decisions about the conduct of the study

name: principal investigator role
description: a responsible party role played by a person responsible for the overall conduct of a study

name: transplantation
description: a protocol application to replace an organ or tissue of an organism

name: biological vector role
description: a biological vector role is a material to be added role that is realized by the process of transmitting material to the organism that is the target of the transmission.

name: pH indicator dye role
description: the role of a dye that is realized when the dye is used in an experiment to measure the pH in a material entity

name: specimen role
description: a role borne by a material entity that is gained during a specimen collection process and that can be realized by use of the specimen in an investigation

name: sequence feature identification objective
description: Sequence_feature_identification_objective is a biological_feature_identification_objective role describing a study designed to examine or characterize molecular features exhibited at the level of a macromolecular sequence, e.g. nucleic acid, protein, polysaccharide.

name: intervention design
description: An intervention design is a study design in which a controlled process applied to the subjects (the intervention) serves as the independent variable manipulated by the experimentalist. The treatment (perturbation or intervention) defined can be defined as a combination of values taken by independent variable manipulated by the experimentalists are applied to the recruited subjects assigned (possibly by applying specific methods) to treatment groups. The specificity of intervention design is the fact that independent variables are being manipulated and a response of the biological system is evaluated via response variables as monitored by possibly a series of assays.

name: worker role
description: a personnel role played by a party who executes a component of the study plan; this can occur before, during, after or outside the study timeline

name: Bernoulli trial
description: An assay where the output data is a datum with one of two values denoting success and failure.

name: gene list
description: A data set of the names or identifiers of genes that are the outcome of an analysis or have been put together for the purpose of an analysis.

name: number of particles in subset
description: A measurement datum measuring the number of subjects in a defined subset in a flow cytometer instrument. The datum has a qualitative role

name: number of lost events electronic
description: A measurement datum measuring the number of analysis events lost due to errors in data acquisition electronic coincidence in a flow cytometer instrument. The datum has a qualitative role.

name: calibration substance role
description: A reference substance role that is realized when characteristics or responses elicited by the bearer are used to ensure an instrument is within protocol specification of accuracy or performance

name: molecular feature identification objective
description: Molecular_feature_identification_objective is a biological_feature_identification_objective role describing a study designed to examine or characterize molecular features of a biological system, e.g. expression profiling, copy number of molecular components, epigenetic modifications.

name: hardware testing objective
description: Hardware_testing_objective is a methodology_testing_objective role describing a study designed to examine the effects of using different hardware, e.g. scanner.

name: incubator
description: A device in which environmental conditions (light, photoperiod, temperature, humidity, etc.) can be controlled

name: obsolete_label role
description: Label role is a role which inheres in a material entity and which is realized in a detection of label assay

name: baseline participant role
description: a reference participant role which is realized by making the reference to qualities at the start of the study or intervention

name: role of independent data monitoring committee
description: a trial monitor role charged recommending whether to continue, modify, or end the trial

name: pathologist role
description: a worker role of being responsible for making the histopathology diagnoses associated with data from a study; this activity occurs outside the study timeline

name: supernatant collection system harvesting frame
description: A device that is designed for collecting 90% of the supernatant in a microplate well and separating the living cell with no stress, eliminating centrifugation and other similar techniques. It can be used in a variety of release assays with different radioactive isotopes, such as Cr51 or I125.

name: filter paper
description: A device manufacture with the intent to provide a porous unsized paper used for filtering.

name: cell co-culturing
description: A material combination in which cell cultures of two or more different types are are combined and allowed to culture as one.

name: role of Institutional Review Board
description: the role of a organization that is realized by members reviewing study designs for their agreement with regulations

name: eSource document
description: an eSource document is a digital document consisting of a logical collection of Source data and other eSource documents that can be presented in an ordered way and capture the time of completion, change, and any signatures

name: crossover population role
description: a role realized when a participant serves as reference to itself

name: complete nutrient role
description: A nutrient role that inheres in a material entity and is realized in the use of that material entity by an organism to provide all needed nourishment.

name: radiolabel role
description: a molecular label role which inheres in a material entity which is realized by the process of radioactivity detection

name: clonal cDNA library
description: Mixed population of cDNAs (complementaryDNA) made from mRNA from a defined source, usually a specific cell type. This term should be associated only to nucleic acid interactors not to their proteins product. For instance in 2h screening use living cells (MI:0349) as sample process.  ALT DEF (PRS):: a cDNA library is a collection of host cells, typically E.Coli cells but not exclusively. modified by transfer of plasmid DNA molecule used as vector containing a fragment or totality of cDNA molecule (the insert) .  cDNA library may have an array of role and applications.

name: electronic case report form
description: An electronic case report form is a digital document used to record all of the protocol required information to be reported for each trial subject. An eCRF has the property that it can be audited and compliant with requirements of 21 CFR Part 11.

name: placebo role
description: a negative reference substance is a reference role in which the substance playing the reference substance role is physically similar in appearance to the test substance

name: autotransplantation
description: is the transplantation of tissue from one part of \ the body to another in the same individual. )

name: parameter threshold
description: A measurement datum measuring the minimal signal that must be detected to generate an electrical event, as compared to the maximal detected signal in a flow cytometer instrument. The datum has a qualitative role

name: study group role
description: a study population role where the bearer is a population of material entities and the role is realized in the implementation of a study design wherein the entities bearing the study population role are observed or subjected to intervention according to the study design and are biological replicates, i.e. they receive the same treatment under the protocol

name: p-value
description: A quantitative confidence value that represents the probability of obtaining a result at least as extreme as that actually obtained, assuming that the actual value was the result of chance alone.

name: population
description: a population is a collection of individuals from the same taxonomic class living, counted or sampled at a particular site or in a particular area

name: nuclear magnetic resonance 3D structure determination assay
description: A 3D structure determination assay that uses magnetic properties of atomic nuclei to determine the 3D structure and dynamics of molecules in the input sample.

name: imaging assay
description: An assay that produces a picture of an entity.

name: protocol optimization objective
description: Protocol_optimization is a protocol_testing_objective role describing a study designed to identify the best protocol.  This may be carried out by comparing different protocols or by modifying the parameters used within a single protocol.

name: role of pathology review board
description: a worker role comprised of providing a confirmed and consensus diagnosis for histopathology results obtained during the investigation

name: microtiter plate
description: A microtiter_plate is a flat plate with multiple wells used as small test tubes.

name: role of impartial witness
description: a role which inheres in a Homo sapiens and is realized during a clinical trial - the impartial witness is independent of the trial and cannot be unfairly influenced by people involved with the trial

name: chromatin immunoprecipitation
description: An immunoprecipitation in which chromatin (i.e. packaged DNA which can include protein and RNA complexes) is cut into short regions, reversibly cross linked, and antibodies or tags are used to select for pieces of chromatin with desired characteristics.

name: biological replicate role
description: a reference participant role realized by equivalent treatment of participants

name: radioactivity detection
description: An assay that measures the amount of radiation in the radioactive spectrum (alpha, beta or gamma rays) emitted from an input material.

name: investigation agent role
description: A role borne by an entity and that is realized in a process that is part of an investigation in which an objective is achieved. These processes include, among others: planning, overseeing, funding, reviewing.

name: nutrient role
description: a role that inheres in a material entity and is realized in the use of that material entity by an organism when it is used in that organism's metabolism and provides nourishment.

name: obsolete_dropout role
description: Dropout is a study subject role borne by an entity realized by a process of leaving the study earlier than the protocol specified and where the bearer of the dropout role had been borne study subject role prior to bearing dropout role.

name: obsolete health care provider role
description: a worker role of providing medical care either within or outside the study timeline

name: methodology testing objective
description: Methodology_testing_objective is an objective role carried out by a proposition defining the aim of the study is to examine the effect of using different methodologies.

name: analytical cytology data file
description: A digital entity intended to capture data in analytical cytology domain.

name: proxy respondent role
description: Proxy respondent is a worker role of describing patient's symptoms or condition to medical personnel

name: fluorescence compensation matrix
description: A fluorescence compensation matrix is a square matrix which is used as the left multiplier of the vector of fluorescence values while performing digital fluorescence compensation. Also, fluorescence compensation matrix is the inverse of the fluorescence spillover matrix.

name: negative reference substance role
description: a reference role in which the characteristics or responses elicited by the substance playing the reference substance role are used to establish a \"no effect\" response

name: role of legally acceptable representative
description: a role which inheres in a human or organization who are able subject to applicable law to consent, on behalf of a prospective subject, to the subject`s participation in as clinical trial.

name: investigation results report
description: An investigation report is a report on the results of an investigation.

name: cellular feature identification objective
description: Cellular_feature_identification_objective is a biological_feature_identification_objective role describing a study designed to examine or characterize a biological feature monitored at the cellular level, e.g. stage of cell cycle, stage of differentiation.

name: reference subject role
description: a reference subject  role which inheres in an organism or entity of organismal origin so that the characteristics or responses of the participant playing the reference participant role are used for comparison or reference

name: vital dye role
description: A dye role that is realized when used to detect live cells in an experiment

name: obsolete_blinded medication role
description: Is a role which inheres in a material entity which is manufactured to be similar in appearance to a test material entity in e.g. a clinical trial to prevent participants from detecting which is the active and inactive substance

name: sub-investigator role
description: a worker role authorized to make study-related decisions and carry out tasks related to the study; this role occurs during the study timeline

name: data encoding
description: a documenting process to encode an information entity into a digital document

name: enzymatic cleavage
description: a material processing that digests the fraction of input material that is susceptible to that enzyme

name: hardware optimization objective
description: Hardware_optimization is a hardware_testing_objective describing a study designed to identify the best hardware.

name: obsolete_defined_material
description: Place holder class, Utility class to gather the defined classes

name: trial statistician role
description: a worker role that analyzes data obtained during a trial or study; this role occurs after the trial or study is completed or terminated.

name: standard error
description: A quantitative confidence value which is the standard deviations of the sample in a frequency distribution, obtained by dividing the standard deviation by the total number of cases in the frequency distribution.

name: antigen role
description: Antigen is a role played by material which when introduced into an immune-competent organism causes an immune response

name: software testing objective
description: Software_testing_objective is a hardware_optimization role describing a study designed to examine the effects of using different software or software parameters, e.g. data processing software.

name: sponsor role
description: a responsible party role involved with any of the following activities:  initiating, managing and funding a study

name: organization
description: An entity that can bear roles, has members, and has a set of organization rules. Members of organizations are either organizations themselves or individual people. Members can bear specific organization member roles that are determined in the organization rules. The organization rules also determine how decisions are made on behalf of the organization by the organization members.

name: feed role
description: a role that inheres in a material entity and is realized in the use of that material entity by lab animal to provide all needed nourishment.

name: technical replicate role
description: technical replicate role is realized when two portions from one evaluant are used in replicate runs of an assay

name: dye role
description: A molecular label role which inheres in a material entity and which is realized in the process of detecting a molecular dye that imparts color to some material of interest.

name: cluster
description: A data set which is a subset of data that are a similar to each other in some way.

name: cohort role
description: a cohort role is a biological replicate role played by a group of study participants who share a common characteristic of interest to the study.

name: artificially induced nucleic acid hybridization
description: Is a material transformation in which strands of nucleic acids that are (somewhat) complementary form a double-stranded molecule. Has input at least two single stranded molecules of nucleic acid molecules.

name: DNA extraction
description: A DNA extraction is a nucleic acid extraction where the desired output material is DNA.

name: plan
description: A plan is a realizable entity that is the inheres in a bearer who is committed to realizing it as a planned process.

name: obsolete_sample population
description: A sample population is an object aggregate that is selected from the population, e.g. the fish in the net that were sampled from the lake, the people that responded to the call for volunteers.

name: organism feature identification objective
description: Organism_feature_identification_objective is a biological_feature_identification_objective role describing a study designed to examine or characterize a biological feature monitored at the level of the organism, e.g. height, weight, stage of development, stage of life cycle.

name: number of lost events computer
description: A measurement datum recording the number of measurement events lost due to overloading of the analysis chip in a flow cytometer instrument. The datum has a qualitative role

name: protocol
description: A plan specification which has sufficient level of detail and quantitative information to communicate it between investigation agents, so that different investigation agents will reliably be able to independently reproduce the process.

name: role of regulator of consumables and medical devices
description: a regulator involved with making and enforcing legislation and governmental orders relevant to the development, testing, manufacture and use of food, drugs and medical devices

name: adding a material entity into a target
description: is a process with the objective to place a material entity bearing the 'material to be added role' into a material bearing the 'target of material addition role'.

name: analyte role
description: A measurand role borne by a molecular entity or an atom and realized in an analyte assay which achieves the objective to measure the magnitude/concentration/amount of the analyte in the entity bearing evaluant role.

name: disease stage
description: a part of an occurrence of a disease process which is associated with position in the normal progression of the disease

name: intraperitoneal injection
description: is the injection of a material entity (bearing the administered substance role) into the peritoneum (bearing the target role) of an organism using a syringe

name: precipitate
description: a precipitate is a material entity which is output of a precipitation process

name: protein-protein interaction detection assay
description: An assay that determines interactions between proteins, such as protein-protein binding.

name: transcription factor binding site assay
description: An assay tthat determines DNA regions specifically recognized by proteins that function as transcription factors

name: obsolete_enrollment
description: enrollment is a process of identifying a set of objects for further use in an investigation based on a set of criteria or rules

name: adverse event trigger
description: revisit?

name: eluate
description: a eluate is a material entity which results from an elution, e.g. from a chromatography column. it has as part a material entity with role mobile phase

name: material to be added role
description: material to be added role is a protocol participant role realized by a material which is added into a material bearing the target of material addition role in a material addition process

name: obsolete_peritoneum
description: is the serous membrane that forms the lining of the abdominal cavity

name: drawing a conclusion based on data
description: A planned process in which data gathered in an investigation is evaluated in the context of existing knowledge with the objective to generate more general conclusions or to conclude that the data does not allow one to draw general conclusion

name: planning
description: a process of creating or modifying a plan specification

name: histological sample preparation
description: histological sample preparation is the preparation of an input tissue via slicing and labeling to make tissue microstructure of interest visible in a future histology assay

name: inductive reasoning
description: a interpreting data that is used to ascribe properties or relations to types based on an observation instance (i.e., on a number of observations or experiences); or to formulate laws based on limited observations of recurring phenomenal patterns.

name: mass analyzer
description: A Mass analyzer is a device that separates ions according to their mass-to-charge ratio. All mass spectrometers are based on dynamics of charged particles in electric and magnetic fields in vacuum where the two laws of Lorentz force law and Newton's second law of motion apply.

name: hypothesis driven investigation
description: is an investigation with the goal to test one or more hypothesis

name: hypothesis generating investigation
description: is an investigation in which data is generated and analyzed with the purpose of generating new hypothesis

name: ion source
description: An ion source is a device that is part of a mass spectrometer that ionizes the material under analysis. The ions are then transported by magnetic or electric fields to the mass analyzer.  Techniques for ionization have been key to determining what types of samples can be analyzed by mass spectrometry. Electron ionization and chemical ionization are used for gases and vapors. In chemical ionization sources, the material is ionized by chemical ion-molecule reactions during collisions in the source. Two techniques often used with liquid and solid biological samples include electrospray ionization (due to John Fenn PMID 2675315.) and matrix-assisted laser desorption/ionization (MALDI, due to M. Karas and F. Hillenkamp (Measuring Mass: From Positive Rays to Proteins by Michael A. Grayson (Editor) (ISBN 0-941901-31-9))).

name: ion detector
description: An ion detector is a device that measures and records the charge induced or current produced when an ion passes by or hits a surface.  Example: In a scanning instrument the signal produced in the detector during the course of the scan versus where the instrument is in the scan (at what m/Q) will produce a mass spectrum, a record of ions as a function of m/Q.

name: metabolite profiling assay
description: An assay that detects and identifies chemical entities resulting from biochemical and cellular metabolism

name: light emission function
description: A light emission function is an excitation function to excite a material to a specific excitation state that it emits light.

name: record function
description: A record function is a function that registers or collects information in a particular format on a particular recording medium. For example on paper or a digital representation

name: magnify function
description: A magnify function is a function to increase the size of a transmitted object image through the precise arrangement of energy diffraction elements along an imaging path.

name: contain function
description: A contain function is a function to constrain a material entities location in space

name: heat function
description: A heat function is a function that increases the internal kinetic energy of a material

name: material separation function
description: A material separation function is a function that increases the resolution between two or more material entities. The  to distinction between the entities is usually based on some associated physical quality.

name: ionize process
description: a physical process of converting an atom or molecule into an ion by adding or removing charged particles such as electrons or other ions. This excludes chemical processes of dissociation.

name: excitation function
description: A excitation function is a function  to inject energy by bombarding a material with energetic particles (e.g., photons) thereby imbuing internal material components such as electrons with additional energy.  These internal, 'excited' particles may lead to the rupturing of covalent chemical bonds or may quickly relax back to there unexcited state with an exponential time course thereby locally emitting energy in the form of photons.

name: freeze function
description: A freeze function is a function to decrease the internal kinetic energy of a material below the freezing point of that type of material.

name: synthesizing function
description: A synthesizing function is a function to assemble new output materials from distinct input materials.  The output materials typically consist of chemically distinct monomeric objects or object aggregate polymers.

name: perturb function
description: A perturb function is a function that disrupts the normal function of a system induced through either internal or external means.  External means of perturbation include: (1) displacement fields in the physical sense - e.g., temperature change, osmotic shock, pressure change; (2) application of small molecules such as drugs or toxins to perturb the function of specific pathways or application of surfactants to perturb the normal function of plasma membrane.  Internal means of perturbation include: (1) manipulation of gene function via gene knockout or transcript knockdown via RNAi; (2) directed genetic mutation leading to minimal aa alterations that interfere with peptide function.

name: filter function
description: A filter function is a function to prevent the flow of certain entities based on a quality or qualities of the entity while allowing entities which have different qualities to pass through

name: mechanical function
description: A mechanical function is a function that is realised via mechanical work (through an certain amount of energy transferred by some force).

name: gas filter function
description: A gas filter function is a filter function which prevents the flow of solid objects, defined by specific qualities, in a gas-solid mixture

name: liquid filter function
description: A liquid filter function is a filter function which prevents the flow of solid objects, defined by specific qualities, in a liquid-solid mixture

name: transfer function
description: A transfer function is a function to displace a material from one location to another.

name: electricity supply function
description: An electricity supply function is an energy supply function to transfer electricity from one source to another, typically a consumer of the electricity or as a stimulus during a neuroscience experiment.
