The Genome Analyzer IIx is the most widely adopted next-generation sequencing platform and proven and published across the broadest range of research applications.

name: Illumina HiSeq 2000
description: A DNA sequencer which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation, with two flow cells and a throughput of up to 55 Gb per day. Built upon sequencing by synthesis technology, the machine is optimized for generation of data for multiple samples in a single run.

name: Illumina HiSeq 2500
description: A DNA sequencer which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation, with two flow cells and a throughput of up to 160 Gb per day. Built upon sequencing by synthesis technology, the machine is optimized for generation of data for batching multiple samples or rapid results on a few samples.

name: MiSeq
description: A DNA sequencer which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation. Built upon sequencing by synthesis technology, the machine provides an end-to-end solution (cluster generation, amplification, sequencing, and data analysis) in a single machine.

name: Methylation 450K BeadChip
description: A methylation BeadChip which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation. Built upon BeadChip tehcnology, the array interrogates ~ 485,000 methylation sites per sample at single-nucleotide resolution.

name: Methylation 27K BeadChip
description: A methylation BeadChip which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation. Built upon BeadChip tehcnology, the array interrogates ~ 27,000 CpG sites per sample at single-nucleotide resolution.

name: 1M-Duo Infinium HD BeadChip
description: A BeadChip which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation. Built upon BeadChip tehcnology, the array integrates ~ 1 million markers per sample for genotyping, and copy number variation (CNV) and Cytogenetic analysis.

name: SOLiD 3 Plus System
description: A DNA sequencer which is manufacted by the Applied Biosystems corporation. Built upon SOLiD sequencing technology, the machine generates greater than 1 billion mappable reads per run.

name: Mouse 385K Whole Genome CGH Tiling Array
description: A tiling array which is manufactured by the Nimblegen corporation. Built to analyze DNA sequence copy number by comparative genomic hybridization for mouse DNA against 385,000 features.
synonyms: ["Nimblegen Mouse 385K Whole Genome CGH Tiling Array"]

name: Mouse 3x720K Whole Genome CGH Tiling Array
description: A tiling array which is manufactured by the Nimblegen corporation. Built to analyze DNA sequence copy number by comparative genomic hybridization for mouse DNA against 3x720,000 features.
synonyms: ["Nimblegen Mouse 3x720K Whole Genome CGH Tiling Array"]

name: Human 3x720K Whole Genome CGH Tiling Array
description: A tiling array which is manufactured by the Nimblegen corporation. Built to analyze DNA sequence copy number by comparative genomic hybridization for human DNA against 3x720,000 features.
synonyms: ["Nimblegen Human 3x720K Whole Genome CGH Tiling Array"]

name: Human 2.1M Whole-Genome CGH Tiling Array v2.0
description: A tiling array which is manufactured by the Nimblegen corporation. Built to analyze DNA sequence copy number by comparative genomic hybridization for human DNA against 2.1 million features.
synonyms: ["Nimblegen Human 2.1M Whole-Genome CGH Tiling Array v2.0"]

name: PacBio RS II
description: A DNA sequencer which is manufactured by the Pacific Biosciences corporation. Built upon single molecule real-time sequencing technology, the machine is optimized for generation with long reads and high consensus accuracy.

name: nCounter Human miRNA Expression array
description: A human array which is manufacutred by NanoString Technologies. Built upon color-coded molecular barcodes technology, the array profiles miRNA with increased specificity and sensitivty than microarrays.

name: DNA methylation profiling by ChIP-chip assay
description: An epigenetic modification assay that identifies sites of DNA methylation using ChIP-chip technologies.

name: transcription profiling by MPSS assay
description: A transcription profiling assay that uses Massive Parallel Signature Sequencing (MPSS).

name: histone modification identification by ChIP-chip assay
description: An epigenetic modification assay that identifies regions containing specific histones and their modifications using ChIP-chip techniques.

name: histone modification identification by ChIP-Seq assay
description: An epigenetic modification assay that identifies regions containing specific histones and their modifications using ChIP-Seq techniques.

name: transcription factor binding site identification by ChIP-chip assay
description: A transcription factor binding site assay that utilizes ChIP-chip technology.

name: transcription factor binding site identification by ChIP-Seq assay
description: A transcription factor binding site assay that utilizes ChIP-seq technology.

name: epigenetic modification assay
description: An assay that identifies epigenetic modifications including histone modifications, open chromatin, and DNA methylation.

name: NextSeq 500
description: A DNA sequencer which is a desktop sequencer ideal for smaller-scale studies manufactured by the Illumina corporation. It supports sequencing of single, long or short insert paired end clone libraries relying on sequencing by synthesis technology.

name: Illumina HiSeq 1000
description: A DNA sequencer which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation, with a single flow cell and a throughput of up to 35 Gb per day. It supports sequencing of single, long or short insert paired end clone libraries relying on sequencing by synthesis technology.

name: Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 tiling array
description: A tiling array which is  a comprehensive whole human genome expression array manufactured by the Affymetrix corporation. Built to analyze DNA sequence copy number by comparative genomic hybridization for human DNA against 47,000 transcripts and variants.
synonyms: ["Affymetrix HT Human Genome U133 Plus 2 Array Plate Set","HG-U133 Plus 2","HG-U133 Plus 2 array"]

name: SOLiD 4 System
description: An AB SOLid System which is manufacted by the Applied Biosystems corporation. Built upon SOLiD sequencing technology, the machine generates greater than 1 billion mappable reads per run.

name: Human Exon 1.0 ST tilling array
description: A tiling microarray which is manufactured by the Affymetrix corporation. Built to analyze 3' DNA sequence copy number by comparative genomic hybridization for human DNA against 28,000 genes. It  can be used for gene expression and alternative splicing assay
synonyms: ["Affymetrix Human Exon 1.0 St Array","Human Exon 1.0","Human Exon 1.0 ST Array"]

name: Human Genome U133 tiling array
description: A tiling array which is manufactured by the Affymetrix corporation. Built to analyze DNA sequence copy number by comparative genomic hybridization for human DNA against 39,000 transcripts and variants.
synonyms: ["Affymetrix HT Human Genome U133 Array Plate Set","HG-U133","HG-U133 array"]

name: Genome Analyzer IIe
description: An Illumina Genome Analyzer II which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation. It supports sequencing of single, long or short insert paired end clone libraries relying on sequencing by synthesis technology. The Genome Analyzer IIe makes industry-leading next-generation sequencing technology accessible to more laboratories.

name: SAGE ditag library preparation
description: A library preparation in which tags identifiying transcripts are created, ligated to form ditags, amplified, concatemerized and ligated into a vector to create a library.

name: serial analysis of gene expression assay
description: A transcription profiling assay that quantifies RNA through creating short signature tags of the messages and ligating them into a larger molecule than was sequenced.

name: genotyping by tiling array assay
description: A genotyping by array assay that uses tiling array technology.
synonyms: ["DNA sequence variation detection by tiling array"]

name: genotyping by SNP array assay
description: A genotyping by array assay that uses SNP array technology.
synonyms: ["DNA sequence variation detection by snp array"]

name: parallel analysis of RNA structure assay
description: A single-nucleotide-resolution nucleic acid structure mapping assay that performs simultaneous in vitro profiling of the secondary structure of thousands of RNA species at single nucleotide resolution using enzymatic probing based on deep sequencing fragments of RNAs that were treated with structure-specific enzymes

name: translation-associated transcript leader sequencing assay
description: An RNA-seq assay that combines TL-seq with polysome fractionation

name: transcript leader sequencing assay
description: An RNA-seq assay that combines enzymatic capture of m(7)G-capped mRNA 5' ends with high-throughput sequencing.

name: peptide mass fingerprinting assay
description: A mass spectrometry assay that measures the absolute mass of the cleaved peptides derived from an unknown protein of interest. These masses are then compared to values for known protein sequences to identify the unknown protein.

name: array based nucleic acid structure mapping assay
description: An assay which aims to provide information about the in vivo organization/structure of nucleic acids using chemical or enzymatic probes using a microarray.

name: micrococcal nuclease digestion followed by tiling array assay
description: An array based nucleic acid structure mapping assay that identifies nucleosome positions genome wide, by detection of regions protected by nucleosomes from digestion by micrococal nuclease using tiling array assays

name: ribosomal profiling by sequencing assay
description: A RNA-seq assay that sequences only mRNA protected by the ribosome during translation.

name: assay for transposase-accessible chromatin using sequencing
description: An assay to capture the location of open chromatin, DNA-binding proteins, individual nucleosomes and chromatin compaction at nucleotide resolution by Tn5 transposase insertion.

name: chromatin isolation by RNA purification sequencing assay
description: A detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay that measures regions of the genome which are bound by a specific RNA (or a by a ribonucleoprotein containing the RNA of interest) using high-throughput sequencing.

name: self-transcribing active regulatory region sequencing assay
description: An RNA-seq assay that identifies the sequences that act as transcriptional enhancers in a direct, quantitative, and genome-wide manner from sheared genomic DNA.

name: carbon-copy chromosome conformation capture assay followed by sequencing assay
description: A carbon-copy chromosome conformation capture assay to analyze the organization of chromosomes in an unbiased, genome-wide manner using high throughput sequening following carbon-copy chromosome conformation capture.
synonyms: ["Carbon-copy chromosome conformation capture assay followed by sequencing","HiC","HiC assay"]

name: individual-nucleotide resolution cross-linking and immunoprecipitation sequencing assay
description: A cross-linking immunoprecipitation high-throughput sequencing assay that identifies protein-RNA interactions using UV light to covalently bind proteins and RNA molecules, allowing for a very stringent purification of the linked protein-RNA complexes.

name: RNA Bind-n-Seq assay
description: An RNA-seq assay that comprehensively characterizes sequence and structural specificity of RNA binding proteins (RBPs).

name: polyA-site sequencing assay
description: A RNA-seq assay that quantitatively profiles RNA polyadenylation at the transcriptome level.

name: surface plasmon resonance sensor chip
description: A device that is used as a binding surface for ligand during a surface plasmon resonance assay, consisting of a glass plate to which a metal film is attached

name: enzyme-linked antibody
description: A processed material that is comprised of an antibody that is covalently linked to an enzyme through bioconjugation. The enzyme can be used as a detection method when the enzyme's reaction produces a detectable signal, for example a color change when the substrate is added.

name: Illumina HiSeq 3000
description: A DNA sequencer manufactured by Illumina corporation, with a single flow cell and a throughput of more than 200 Gb per day.

name: Illumina HiSeq 4000
description: A DNA sequencer manufactured by Illumina corporation, with two flow cell and a throughput of more than 400 Gb per day.

name: 3D structure determining assay of a MHC:ligand complex
description: A MHC:ligand binding assay that uses a 3D structure determination of bound complex assay.

name: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific protection from infectious challenge based on pathogen burden
description: A B cell epitope in vivo intervention experiment that uses a epitope protection experiment based on pathogen burden.

name: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific protection from tumor challenge
description: A B cell epitope in vivo intervention experiment that uses a epitope protection experiment based on tumor burden.

name: microarray assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex
description: A B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody assay that uses a microarray.

name: NMR assay measuring the dissociation constant [KD] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex
description: A B cell epitope equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses a nuclear magnetic resonance assay.

name: assay measuring T cell epitope specific biological activity
description: A T cell epitope recognition assay that detects biological activity.

name: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 17 production by T cells
description: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects production of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 17 production by T cells.

name: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific macrophage migration inhibitory factor (MIF) production by T cells
description: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects macrophage migration inhibitory factor (MIF) production by T cells.

name: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific oncostatin M production by T cells
description: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects oncostatin M production by T cells.

name: assay measuring a binding constant of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
description: A T cell epitope recognition assay that quantitavely characterizes the binding of a TCR with a ligand by determining a binding constant.

name: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 17 production by T cells
description: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 17 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.

name: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 production by T cells
description: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.

name: in vitro assay measuring epitope specific T cell killing
description: A T cell epitope specific killing assay that uses an in vitro cell killing assay.

name: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific granzyme A release by T cells
description: A T cell epitope specific granzyme A release assay that uses a cytometric bead array assay.

name: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific granzyme A release by T cells
description: A T cell epitope specific granzyme A release assay that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.

name: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific granzyme B release by T cells
description: A T cell epitope specific granzyme B release assay that uses a cytometric bead array assay.

name: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific granzyme B release by T cells
description: A T cell epitope specific granzyme B release assay that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.

name: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific macrophage migration inhibitory factor (MIF) production by T cells
description: An assay of epitope specific macrophage migration inhibitory factor (MIF) production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.

name: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific oncostatin M production by T cells
description: An assay of epitope specific oncostatin M production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.

name: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific perforin release by T cells
description: A T cell epitope specific perforin release assay that uses an ELISPOT assay.

name: in vivo assay measuring epitope specific proliferation of T cells
description: A T cell epitope specific proliferation assay that is performed in vivo.

name: in vitro assay measuring epitope specific proliferation of T cells
description: A T cell epitope specific proliferation assay that is performed on cells in vitro.

name: assay measuring qualitiative binding of a MHC:ligand complex
description: A MHC:ligand binding assay that detects qualitative binding.

name: in vivo assay measuring T cell epitope specific protection from challenge
description: An efficacy of T cell epitope intervention experiment that uses a epitope protection experiment.

name: in vitro assay measuring T cell epitope specific suppression
description: T cell epitope dependent biological activity assay that detects suppression of an in vitro response.

name: MHC ligand assay
description: An immune epitope assay that detects either the processing and presentation of a ligand by an antigen presenting cell or the binding of a ligand to an MHC molecule.

name: collection of specimens
description: A material entity that has two or more specimens as its parts.

name: specimens derived from shared ancestor
description: A collection of specimens derived from one common specimen via one or more material processing process(es).

name: specimen set collection process
description: A specimen collection process that generates multiple specimens from one source (e.g. one organism) during a time period which for the purpose of the study can be considered to be taken at the same sampling time.

name: specimens collected in one encounter
description: A collection of specimens that is collected from one source (e.g. one organism) during a time period which for the purpose of the study can be considered to be taken at the same sampling time.

name: human specimen set
description: A specimen set that is collected from one person during a time period which for the purpose of the study can be considered to be taken at the same sampling time.

name: specimens collected longitudinally
description: A collection of specimens that was derived from the same source material entity at different time points in order to observe changes in that entity.

name: reporter gene assay
description: An assay that detects expression of a reporter gene that was inserted under the control of a regulatory sequence of interest.

name: enhancer activity detection by reporter gene assay
description: A reporter gene assay that detects expression of a reporter gene that was inserted under the control of an enhancer of interest.

name: transcription cofactor activity region identification by ChIP-Seq assay
description: A ChIP-seq assay that identifies regions of chromatin bound to a chromatin modifying protein, e.g. a histone acetyltransferase.
synonyms: ["chromatin modifier binding site identification by ChIP-Seq assay"]

name: transcript expression location detection by hybridization chain reaction assay
description: An in situ hybridization assay in which the location (e.g. anatomical/tissue) of a transcript is detected by a multiplexed fluorescent in situ hybridization, based on orthogonal amplification with hybridization chain reactions (HCR). RNA probes complementary to mRNA targets trigger chain reactions in which fluorophore-labeled RNA hairpins self-assemble into tethered fluorescent amplification polymers.
synonyms: ["transcript expression location detection by fluorescent HCR."]

name: Tet-assisted bisulfite sequencing assay
description: A bisulfite sequencing assay that identifies genomic methylation patterns by using a bisulfite based protocol with the Tet enzyme to differentiate 5-hydroxylmethylcytosine (5hmC) from 5-methylcytosine (5mC) through a step-wise oxidative demethylation of 5mC, converting it to 5-carboxylcytosine (5caC) while keeping 5hmC protected.

name: containing a specimen function
description: A contain function that involves physical contact with a specimen. This function is typically performed in such a way that the specimen is usable for an investigation or assay.

name: specimen container
description: A container with the function of containing a specimen.

name: physical store
description: A container with an environmental control function.

name: rapid amplification of cDNA ends
description: A reverse transcribed polymerase chain reaction that is used to amplify a mRNA sequence between a defined internal site and the 5' or 3' end of the mRNA.

name: 5' rapid amplification of cDNA ends
description: A rapid amplication of cDNA ends to amplify a mRNA sequence between a defined internal site and the 5' end of the mRNA.

name: 3' rapid amplification of cDNA ends
description: A rapid amplication of cDNA ends to amplify a mRNA sequence between a defined internal site and the 3' end of the mRNA.

name: 5' RNA ligase mediated rapid amplification of cDNA ends
description: A 5' rapid amplification pf cDNA ends that uses RNA ligase to add an RNA adapter oligonucleotide to intact 5' mRNA ends, allowing the amplification of cDNA only from full-length, capped mRNA.

name: MethylC-Capture sequencing assay
description: A bisulfite sequencing assay in which a whole-genome sequencing library is prepared, bisulfite converted and amplified, followed by a capture enriching for targeted bisulfite-converted DNA fragments that are are subsequently identified by DNA sequencing.

name: specimen family creation
description: A material processing that has as its input a specimen and as its output a collection of specimens.

name: carboxyfluorescein succinimidyl ester staining assay measuring epitope specific proliferation of T cells
description: A T cell epitope specific proliferation assay performed on cells in vitro that uses a CFSE assay.

name: assay measuring the dissociation constant [KD] of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
description: A T cell epitope binding constant determination assay that measures the dissociation constant KD.

name: assay measuring the on rate [kon] of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
description: A T cell epitope binding constant determination assay that measures the on rate.

name: assay measuring the off rate [koff] of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
description: A T cell epitope binding constant determination assay that measures the off rate.

name: assay measuring the association constant [KA] of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
description: A T cell epitope binding constant determination assay that measures the association constant KA.

name: small-angle scattering assay determining the 3D structure of a B cell epitope:antibody complex
description: A B cell epitope 3D structure determination assay that uses a small-angle X-ray scattering assay.

name: bio-layer interferometry assay measuring the on rate [kon] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex
description: A B cell epitope assay that measures the on rate using a bio-layer interferometry assay.

name: bio-layer interferometry assay measuring the off rate [koff] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex
description: A B cell epitope assay that measures the off rate using a bio-layer interferometry assay.

name: bio-layer interferometry assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex
description: A B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody assay that uses a bio-layer interferometry assay.

name: bio-layer interferometry assay measuring the dissociation constant [KD] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex
description: A B cell epitope equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses a bio-layer interferometry assay.

name: carboxyfluorescein succinimidyl ester staining assay
description: a assay detecting a molecular label assay where the amount of carboxyfluorescein succinimidyl ester is measured using fluorescence detection.

name: bio-layer interferometry assay
description: A binding assay that detects a shift in the interference pattern reflected from a layer of immobilized material on the biosensor tip to measure binding to- or dissociating from the material on the biosensor.

name: small-angle scattering assay
description: A 3D structure determination assay in which the scattering pattern of a neutron or x-ray beam targeted at a material entity is recorded at small angles relative to the incident beam to determine the size, shape and structure of the material entity examined.

name: Human 6x630K CGH Whole Genome Tiling Array
description: A tiling array which is manufactured by the Nimblegen corporation to analyze DNA sequence copy number by comparative genomic hybridization for human DNA against 6x630,000 features.
synonyms: ["NimbleGen Human 6x630K CGH Whole Genome Tiling Array"]

name: digital object identifier
description: A centrally registered identifier symbol used to uniquely identify objects given by International DOI Foundation. The DOI system is particularly used for electronic documents such as journal articles.

name: enhanced cross-linking immunoprecipitation high-throughput sequencing assay
description: An iCLIP assay that is enhanced to robustly identify protein-RNA interactions with high efficiency through improvements in library preparation of RNA fragments.

name: small RNA sequencing assay
description: An RNA-seq assay which is targeting small RNA (< 200 bp) sequences such as, but not exclusive to, miRNAs using, for example, small RNA library preparation kits.

name: bromouridine labeling and sequencing assay
description: An RNA-seq assay to identify spans of nascent transcription in the genome through isolation of recent bromouridine (Bru) labelled RNAs.

name: bromouridine pulse-chase and sequencing assay
description: An RNA-seq assay to identify RNA populations of specific ages through isolation of RNAs first labelled with bromouridine (Bru) followed by chasing in uridine for different periods of time.

name: cytometry time of flight assay
description: A cytometry assay in which the presence of molecules of interest on or in cells is indicated by binding of antibodies labeled with rare earth element tags which are detected by time-of-flight mass spectrometry.

name: high performance liquid chromotography assay
description: An analytical chromatography assay that utilizes a high performance liquid chromatography instrument for separation of compounts in a solution.

name: whole genome sequencing assay
description: A DNA sequencing assay that intends to provide information about the sequence of an entire genome of an organism.

name: exome sequencing assay
description: A DNA sequencing assay that intends to provide information about the sequence of the protein coding components of a genome (exons).

name: microscopy assay
description: An imaging assay that utilizes a microscope to magnify features of the visualized material of interest that are not visible to naked eye.

name: mixed lymphocyte reaction assay
description: A cytometry assay where lymphocytes from two individuals are co-cultured with the lymphocytes from one of the allogeneic individuals (Responders) being labeled (with 3H Thymidine or BrdU) and the proliferation of the labeled cells is measured, which is thought to reflect recognition of histocompatibility antigens on the unlabeled cells (stimulators).

name: killer cell immunoglobulin-like receptor typing assay
description: A genotyping assay in which the alleles of genes encoding for killer cell immunoglobulin-like receptors are determined.

name: major histocompatibility typing assay
description: A genotyping assay in which the alleles of genes encoding for major histocompatibility complex molecules are determined.

name: IHC slide staining
description: A staining using labeled antibodies, i.e. the analytical part of immunohistochemistry. The staining is applied to fixed specimens on slides to identify biomarkers in tissues.

name: H&E slide staining
description: A staining using hematoxylin and eosin. The staining is applied to fixed specimens on slides to observe the whole structure and morphology of cells in a tissue; nuclei are stained dark blue/purple while cytoplasm is stained pink.

name: H&E-stained fixed tissue slide specimen
description: A fixed tissue slide specimen that is the output of H&E slide staining.

name: IHC-stained fixed tissue slide specimen
description: A fixed tissue slide specimen that is the output of immunohistochemistry slide staining.

name: single cell specimen
description: A cell specimen that contains only one cell.

name: Illumina Genome Analyzer
description: A DNA sequencer manufactured by Solexa as one of its first sequencer lines, launched in 2006, and capable of sequencing 1 gigabase (Gb) of data in a single run.

name: Illumina HiSeq X Ten
description: A DNA sequencer that consists of a set of 10 HiSeq X Sequencing Systems.

name: Illumina Infinium Omni5Exome-4 Kit
description: An Illumina BeadChip which is an array that interrogates over 4.3 million whole-genome variants for genotyping and copy number variation.

name: Illumina Infinium MethylationEPIC BeadChip
description: An Illumina methylation BeadChip which is an array that interrogates ~ 850,000 methylation sites per sample at single-nucleotide resolution.

name: pulse stable isotope labeling by amino acids in cell culture
description: An assay that detects differences in protein abundance using samples that have been metabolically labeled in vivo with a stable non-radioactive heavy isotope containing amino acid for a short period of time. After diluting the pulsed cells into growth media without label, high resolution mass spectrometry-based proteomics is used to analyze the time-dependent decay and determine protein stability.

name: cytometric bead array assay measuring  epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 20 production by T cells
description: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 20 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.

name: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 20 production by T cells
description: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 20 production by T cells.

name: RNA Integrity Number calculation
description: A data transformation using the RIN algorithm to generate a quality measure of RNA based on features from an electrophoretic trace.

name: RNA Integrity Number value specification
description: A value specification that specifies the value of the RNA Integrity Number as a real value between 1 (most degraded) and 10 (most intact).

name: temperature value specification
description: A value specification that specifies the temperature of some thing.

name: volume value specification
description: A value specification that specifies the volume of some thing.

name: temperature measurement assay
description: An assay to determine the temperature of an evaluant.

name: volume measurement assay
description: An assay to determine the volume of an evaluant.

name: Nanostring nCounter miRNA expression assay
description: A microRNA profiling assay using digital molecular barcoding technology to quantify target microRNA molecules without the need for amplification.

name: bromouride labeling and sequencing after UV exposure
description: An RNA-seq assay to identify transcription start sites and active enhancer elements through isolation of bromouridine (Bru) labelled RNAs after UV light exposure introduces transcription-blocking lesions.

name: extrachromosomal circular DNA sequencing assay
description: An assay which aims at identifying the endogenous population of extrachromosomal circular DNA originating from a subset of genomic loci and potentially having profound consequences on the regulatory and coding capabilities of these regions. The assay includes creation of a library out of the circular DNA molecules and subsequent sequencing using parallelized sequencing methods.

name: antigen specific antibodies assay
description: An analyte assay that measures the presence or amount of antibodies to a specified antigen.

name: HIV antibody assay
description: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect antibodies that bind to human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) antigens.

name: HIV group O antibody assay
description: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect antibodies that bind to human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) group O antigens.

name: surface HBV antibody assay
description: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect antibodies that bind to hepatitis B virus (HBV) surface antigens.

name: core HBV antibody assay
description: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect antibodies that bind to hepatitis B virus (HBV) core antigens.

name: core HBV IgM antibody assay
description: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detectimmunoglobulin M (IgM) antibodies that bind to hepatitis B virus (HBV) core antigens.

name: HCV antibody assay
description: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect antibodies that bind to Hepacivirus C (HCV) antigens.

name: EBV IgG antibody assay
description: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect immunoglobulin G (IgG) antibodies that bind to Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) antigens.

name: EBV IgM antibody assay
description: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect immunoglobulin M (IgM) antibodies that bind to Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) antigens.

name: CMV antibody assay
description: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect antibodies that bind to cytomegalovirus (CMV) antigens.

name: venereal disease research laboratory test
description: An analyte assay that is meant to detect general antibodies that react with substances that are produced by cellular damage caused by Treponema pallidum indicating a syphilis infection. VDRL tests require a microscope and can be done on cerebrospinal fluid as well as blood.

name: rapid plasma reagin test
description: An analyte assay that is meant to detect with the aid of carbon or charcoal particles general antibodies that react with substances that are produced by cellular damage caused by Treponema pallidum indicating a syphilis infection. RPR tests can be done without a microscope.

name: HBV surface antigen assay
description: An analyte assay that is meant to detect hepatitis B virus (HBV) surface antigens.

name: HIV-1 nucleic acid testing
description: An analyte assay that is meant to detect human immunodeficiency virus (HIV-1) nucleic acids.

name: HCV nucleic acid testing
description: An analyte assay that is meant to detect hepatitis C virus (HCV) nucleic acids.

name: multiplexed indexed T7 ChIP-seq assay
description: A ChIP-seq assay which leverages T7 promoter amplification to allow low sample input and chromatin barcoding and pool-and-split multiplexing for high-throughput, quantitative profiling of chromatin states.

name: systematic evolution of ligands by exponential enrichment assay
description: A binding assay that identifies protein-binding sites on nucleic acids by selecting high-affinity target ligands from a randomized pool. The process is repeated in rounds, then the bound nucleic acids are separated from the unbound nucleic acids and amplified by PCR._

name: footprinting assay
description: An assay that measures ligand binding and conformational changes by the solvent accessibility of the backbone, bases, or side-chain structures of macromolecules through their sensitivity to chemical or enzymatic cleavage or modification reactions.

name: DNAse footprinting assay
description: An enzymatic footprinting assay that determines protein-binding sites on DNA by identifying bound fragments that are protected from DNAse I-catalyzed hydrolysis

name: mammalian 2-hybrid assay
description: A binding assay that increases the expression of a reporter gene in mammalian cells by proteins of interest attached to two portions of the transcriptional activator, bringing those portions closer together.

name: protein localization assay
description: An assay that determines the specific location of a protein. Subcellular localization is distinguished from tissue-based localization based on the type of microscopy applied.

name: tissue-based protein localization assay
description: A protein localization assay that determines the specific location of a protein in a living tissue sample.

name: subcellular protein localization assay
description: A protein localization assay that determines the specific subcellular location of a protein. The location is visualized through electron microscopy.

name: subcellular protein immunohistochemistry assay
description: An immunohistochemistry assay that uses antibodies to display the specific subcellular location of proteins.

name: ChIP-qPCR assay
description: A ChIP assay that uses quantitative PCR to determine levels of specific DNA in immunoprecipitated samples.

name: genomic SELEX
description: A systematic evolution of ligands by exponential enrichment assay that starts with a library derived from genomic DNA instead of synthetically derived random DNA molecules.

name: dot blot assay
description: An analyte assay that detects molecules in a mixture dotted on a membrane using DNA probes or antibodies.

name: Northwestern blot assay
description: A direct binding assay that detects interactions of labeled RNA with immobilized protein on a membrane.

name: Southwestern blot assay
description: A direct binding assay that detects interactions of labeled DNA with immobilized protein on a membrane.

name: immunocytochemistry
description: An immuno staining assay in which samples of intact cells are examined that have had most, if not all, of their surrounding extracellular matrix removed

name: ATP bioluminescence assay
description: An analyte assay that detects ATP concentration through light intensity when luciferase catalyzes the oxidation of luciferin in the presence of ATP, magnesium ions, and molecular oxygen.
synonyms: ["ATP quantitation assay","cell viability ATP quantitation assay"]

name: electrophysiology assay
description: An assay that measures the electrical properties of biological cells or tissues. Typically, this assay will generate measurements of voltage changes or electric current (or other associated variables such as impedence or capacitance).

name: patch clamp assay
description: An intracellular electrophysiology assay where a glass micropipette is sealed to the surface of the cell membrane as a recording electrode to study ion channel activity. The key distinction of this technique is the electrical resistance of the seal between the cell membrane and the pipette is of the order 10-100 gigaohms, permitting high-resolution current measurements over the cell membrane in several different standard configurations.

name: whole-cell patch clamp assay
description: A patch-clamp assay where the electrode is left in place on the cell, as in cell-attached recordings, but the membrane patch has been perforated, providing access from the interior of the pipette to the intracellular space of the cell. Measurements made with this technique involve recording currents through multiple channels simultaneously, over the membrane of the entire cell.

name: cell-attached patch clamp assay
description: A patch-clamp assay where the electrode is left in place on the cell, and the membrane patch has been left intact been perforated. This maintains the separation of the interior of the pipette to the intracellular space of the cell. Measurements made with this technique involve recording currents through multiple channels simultaneously, over the membrane of the entire cell.

name: inside-out patch clamp assay
description: A patch-clamp assay where a patch of the membrane is attached to the patch pipette, detached from the rest of the cell, and the cytosolic surface of the membrane is exposed to the external media, or bath. This provides the experimenter has access to the intracellular surface of the membrane via the bath and can manipulate the environment at the intracellular surface of single ion channels. For example, channels that are activated by intracellular ligands can then be studied through a range of ligand concentrations.

name: outside-out patch clamp assay
description: A patch-clamp assay where a patch of the membrane is attached to the patch pipette. In this configuration, the external surface of the cell membrane is exposed as the outside of the membrane patch relative to the patch electrode. An outside-out patch starts with a gigaohm seal in a whole-cell recording configuration. The electrode is slowly withdrawn from the cell, until a fragment of membrane bulges away from the cell, which detaches and reforms as a convex membrane on the end of the electrode, with the original external surface of the membrane facing outward from the electrode. This provides the experimenter with access to the extracellular surface of the membrane via the bath and can manipulate the environment at the extracellular surface of single ion channels.

name: voltage clamp assay
description: An cellular electrophysiology assay where the membrane potential of a cell is controlled by the experimentalist. This is accomplished through a feedback mechanism where any change in membrane potential is countered by permitting electrical current to flow into or out of the cell.

name: two electrode voltage clamp assay
description: The two electrode voltage clamp (TEVC) method utilizes two low-resistance pipettes, one sensing voltage and the other injecting current. The microelectrodes are filled with conductive solution and inserted into the cell to artificially control membrane potential. The membrane acts as a dielectric as well as a resistor, while the fluids on either side of the membrane function as capacitors. The microelectrodes compare the membrane potential against a command voltage, giving an accurate reproduction of the currents flowing across the membrane. Current readings can be used to analyze the electrical response of the cell to different applications. This technique is mainly used in the Oocyte preparation.

name: cut open oocyte voltage clamp assay
description: The cut-open oocyte Vaseline gap (COVG) voltage-clamp technique is designed to solve weaknesses in the two elextrode voltage clamp by maximizing the benefits of the Xenopus oocyte expression system by improving on clamp speed, signal-to-noise ratio, and ability to effectively perfuse the oocyte. In this way, it was possible to combine the most popular transient expression system, and the associated benefits of molecular cloning and site-directed mutagenesis, with the superior voltage-clamp properties of cut-open cell techniques.

name: current clamp assay
description: The current clamp technique records the membrane potential by injecting current into a cell through the recording electrode. Unlike in the voltage clamp mode, where the membrane potential is held at a level determined by the experimenter, in \"current clamp\" mode the membrane potential is free to vary, and the amplifier records whatever voltage the cell generates on its own or as a result of stimulation. This technique is used to study how a cell responds when electric current enters a cell; this is important for instance for understanding how neurons respond to neurotransmitters that act by opening membrane ion channels.

name: electroencephalography
description: An extracellular electrophysiology assay where electrodes are mounted outside the brain (either on the surface of the scalp on onto the brain surface itself during surgery) to measure the electrical field over the external surface.

name: single-unit recording
description: An extracellular electrophysiology assay where a single microelectrode is placed in close proximity to a single neuron to measure voltage and current changes over time. This is the technicque used by Hubel and Wiesel to measure firing properties of primary visual cortex neurons in the 1950s in their original Nobel-prize winning study. A classic, old technique.

name: multi-unit recording
description: An extracellular electrophysiology assay where a collection of microelectrodes (often in an 'array' configuration) is placed into neural tissue to measure the distribution of voltage and current changes for a population of cells over time.

name: local field potential recording
description: An extracellular electrophysiology assay where a microelectrode is placed in the extracellular space of brain tissue to measure action potential and compared to an electrode either outside or inside that tissue.

name: courier organization
description: An organization that delivers messages, packages, and mail.

name: courier tracking number
description: A centrally registered identifier symbol assigned by a courier organization in order to track the delivery of an item.

name: Leica Peloris rapid tissue processor
description: An automatic tissue processor that is a dual retort tissue processor manufactured by the Leica company to provide fast, high quality tissue processing for histology laboratories.

name: Microm Ergostar HM200
description: A microtome that is manufactured by Microm and uses a vertical cutting stroke common to all rotary microtomes engaged by a horizontal sliding movement. An operating arm replaces the handwheel and is attached to both sides of the instrument for greater convenience to permit control of sectioning from the left or right.

name: microtome blade
description: A device that is the part of a microtome used to slice specimens to a desired thickness.

name: Sakura Low profile Accu-Edge microtome blade
description: A microtome blade that is manufactured by Feather and is disposable. The ultra-sharp blades section specimens without striations, distortion or chattering.

name: tissue section thickness
description: A length measurement datum that is the result of an assay measuring the thickness of a tissue section.

name: molecular analysis facility organization
description: An organization that provides molecular analysis service.

name: reason for lack of data item
description: An information content entity that provides an explanation why a data item is not provided.

name: cannot be assessed determination
description: A reason for lack of data item that is the negative output of a determination if assay will provide reliable results.

name: determination if assay will provide reliable results
description: A planned process that is used to assess whether an assay will provide reliable results based on the conditions or qualities of the inputs, devices, and other participants of the assay.

name: GX
description: A cannot be assessed determination for histologic tumor grade.

name: pTX
description: A cannot be assessed determination for pathologic primary tumor staging.

name: pNX
description: A cannot be assessed determination of pathologic staging of lymph nodes.

name: histologic grade according to AJCC 7th edition
description: A categorical value specification that is a histologic grade assigned to a tumor slide specimen according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) 7th Edition grading system.

name: histologic grade according to the Fuhrman Nuclear Grading System
description: A categorical value specification that is a histologic grade assigned to a tumor slide specimen according to the Fuhrman Nuclear Grading System.

name: histologic grade for ovarian tumor
description: A categorical value specification that is a histologic grade assigned to a ovarian tumor.

name: histologic grade for ovarian tumor according to a two-tier grading system
description: A histologic grade for ovarian tumor that is from a two-tier histological classification of tumors.

name: histologic grade for ovarian tumor according to the World Health Organization
description: A histologic grade for ovarian tumor that is from a histological classification by the World Health Organization (WHO).

name: pathologic primary tumor stage for colon and rectum according to AJCC 7th edition
description: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of colorectal cancer following the rules of the TNM American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) version 7 classification system as they pertain to staging of the primary tumor. TNM pathologic primary tumor findings are based on clinical findings supplemented by histopathologic examination of one or more tissue specimens acquired during surgery.
synonyms: ["pT: Pathologic spread colorectal primary tumor (AJCC 7th Edition)"]

name: pathologic primary tumor stage for lung according to AJCC 7th edition
description: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of lung cancer following the rules of the TNM American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) version 7 classification system as they pertain to staging of the primary tumor. TNM pathologic primary tumor findings are based on clinical findings supplemented by histopathologic examination of one or more tissue specimens acquired during surgery.
synonyms: ["pT: Pathologic spread lung primary tumor (AJCC 7th Edition)"]

name: pathologic primary tumor stage for kidney according to AJCC 7th edition
description: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of renal cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to staging of the primary tumor. TNM pathologic primary tumor findings are based on clinical findings supplemented by histopathologic examination of one or more tissue specimens acquired during surgery.
synonyms: ["pT: Pathologic spread kidney primary tumor (AJCC 7th Edition)"]

name: pathologic primary tumor stage for ovary according to AJCC 7th edition
description: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of ovarian cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to staging of the primary tumor. TNM pathologic primary tumor findings are based on clinical findings supplemented by histopathologic examination of one or more tissue specimens acquired during surgery.
synonyms: ["pT: Pathologic spread ovarian primary tumor (AJCC 7th Edition)"]

name: pathologic lymph node stage for colon and rectum according to AJCC 7th edition
description: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of colorectal cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to staging of regional lymph nodes.
synonyms: ["pN: Pathologic spread colon lymph nodes (AJCC 7th Edition)"]

name: pathologic lymph node stage for lung according to AJCC 7th edition
description: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of lung cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to staging of regional lymph nodes.
synonyms: ["pN: Pathologic spread colon lymph nodes (AJCC 7th Edition)"]

name: pathologic lymph node stage for kidney according to AJCC 7th edition
description: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of renal cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to staging of regional lymph nodes.
synonyms: ["pN: Pathologic spread kidney lymph nodes (AJCC 7th Edition)"]

name: pathologic lymph node stage for ovary according to AJCC 7th edition
description: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of ovarian cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to staging of regional lymph nodes.
synonyms: ["pN: Pathologic spread ovarian lymph nodes (AJCC 7th Edition)"]

name: pathologic distant metastases stage for colon according to AJCC 7th edition
description: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of colon cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases. TNM pathologic distant metastasis findings are based on clinical findings supplemented by histopathologic examination of one or more tissue specimens acquired during surgery.

name: pathologic distant metastases stage for lung according to AJCC 7th edition
description: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of lung cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases. TNM pathologic distant metastasis findings are based on clinical findings supplemented by histopathologic examination of one or more tissue specimens acquired during surgery.

name: pathologic distant metastases stage for kidney according to AJCC 7th edition
description: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of renal cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases. TNM pathologic distant metastasis findings are based on clinical findings supplemented by histopathologic examination of one or more tissue specimens acquired during surgery.

name: pathologic distant metastases stage for ovary according to AJCC 7th edition
description: A categorical value specification that is a  pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of ovarian cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases. TNM pathologic distant metastasis findings are based on clinical findings supplemented by histopathologic examination of one or more tissue specimens acquired during surgery.

name: clinical tumor stage group according to AJCC 7th edition
description: A categorical value specification that is an assessment of the stage of a cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) v7 staging systems.

name: International Federation of Gynecology and Obstetrics cervical cancer stage value specification
description: A categorical value specification that is an assessment of the stage of a gynecologic cancer according to the International Federation of Gynecology and Obstetrics (FIGO) staging systems.

name: International Federation of Gynecology and Obstetrics ovarian cancer stage value specification
description: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of ovarian cancer following the rules of the FIGO classification system.
synonyms: ["Pathologic Tumor Stage Grouping for ovarian cancer (FIGO)"]

name: performance status value specification
description: A categorical value specification that is an assessment of a participant's performance status (general well-being and activities of daily life).

name: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group score value specification
description: A performance status value specification designed by the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group to assess disease progression and its affect on the daily living abilities of the patient.

name: Karnofsky score vaue specification
description: A performance status value specification designed for classifying patients 16 years of age or older by their functional impairment.

name: clinical history of cancer
description: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer.

name: clinical history devoid of cancer
description: A clinical history in which there was no diagnosis of cancer.

name: unknown clinical history of cancer
description: A clinical history in which it is not known whether there was a diagnosis of cancer.

name: diagnosis of cancer
description: A diagnosis that is an assertion that a patient who is the subject of a diagnostic process has cancer.

name: family clinical history of cancer
description: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a blood relative.

name: aunt clinical history of cancer
description: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in the female sibling of a parent.

name: brother clinical history of cancer
description: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a male sibling.

name: daughter clinical history of cancer
description: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a person's female child.

name: father clinical history of cancer
description: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a male parent.

name: mother clinical history of cancer
description: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a female parent.

name: sister clinical history of cancer
description: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a female sibling.

name: son clinical history of cancer
description: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a person's male child.

name: uncle clinical history of cancer
description: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a male sibling of a parent.

name: grandmother clinical history of cancer
description: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a female parent of a parent.

name: grandfather clinical history of cancer
description: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a male parent of a parent.

name: nephew clinical history of cancer
description: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a male child of a sibling.

name: niece clinical history of cancer
description: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a female child of a sibling.

name: diagnosis of infectious disease
description: A diagnosis that is an assertion that a patient who is the subject of a diagnostic process has an infectious disease.

name: diagnosis of hepatitis B
description: A diagnosis of infectious disease caused by the hepatitis B virus.

name: diagnosis of hepatitis C
description: A diagnosis of infectious disease caused by the hepatitis C virus.

name: diagnosis of HIV
description: A diagnosis of infectious disease caused by the human immunodeficiency virus (1 or 2).

name: clinical history of repeated HIV assays
description: A clinical history in which there is repeated reactive screening assays for human immunodeficiency virus (1 or 2) antibodies regardless of the results of supplemental assays.

name: exposure to second hand smoke
description: A clinical history in which there has been second hand exposure to tobacco smoking.

name: exposure to second hand smoke in household during childhood
description: An exposure to second hand smoke that occurred in the (patient's) household when the person was a child.

name: exposure to second hand smoke in current household
description: An exposure to second hand smoke in person's current household.

name: pregnancy history
description: A clinical history in which a female has had a pregnancy.

name: number of pregnancies
description: A measurement datum of the total number of pregnancies a woman has had.

name: number of live births
description: A measurement datum of the total number of live births a female has had.

name: age when gave birth to first child
description: An age measurement datum performed on a female when her first biological child was born.

name: gynecologic surgery history
description: A clinical history in which a woman has had gynecologic surgery in the past.

name: hysterectomy history
description: A gynecologic surgery history in which a woman has had a hysterectomy.

name: unilateral oophorectomy history
description: A gynecologic surgery history in which a woman has had a unilateral oophorectomy.

name: neither hysterectomy nor oophorectomy history
description: A gynecologic surgery history in which a woman has not had either a hysterectomy or an oophorectomy.

name: hormonal birth control use history
description: An information content entity that indicates whether a woman has ever used oral contraceptives in order to block ovulation and prevent the occurrence of pregnancy.

name: hormonal birth control former use history
description: A hormonal birth control use history that indicates an individual has previously been a hormonal birth control user but is not a current user.

name: hormonal birth control current use history
description: A hormonal birth control use history that indicates an individual is currently a hormonal birth control user.

name: no hormonal birth control use history
description: A hormonal birth control use history that indicates an individual has not ever been a hormonal birth control user.

name: hormonal replacement therapy history
description: A clinical history in which an individual has had hormonal replacement therapy in the past.

name: delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy
description: A processed material used for delivery of hormones in hormone replacement therapy.

name: pill delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy
description: A delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy that is a pill for oral administration.

name: patch delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy
description: A delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy that is a patch for transdermal administration.

name: cream delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy
description: A delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy that is a cream for transdermal administration.

name: menopausal status
description: An information content entity that indicates the state of a female's cessation of menstruation.

name: indeterminate menopausal status
description: A menopausal status that is neither pre- nor post-menopausal.

name: premenopausal status
description: A menopausal status indicating that less than 6 months has passed since the last menstrual period and there has not been prior bilateral oophorectomy and not on estrogen replacement.

name: perimenopausal status
description: A menopausal status indicating that it has been 6-12 months since last menstrual period.

name: postmenopausal status
description: A menopausal status indicating that it has been more than 12 months since the last menstrual period with no prior hysterectomy or that there has been a prior bilateral oophorectomy.

name: exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history
description: A information content entity that indicates the exposure of an individual to carcinogens in the workplace or environment.

name: exposure to arsenic history
description: An exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history where the carcinogen is arsenic.

name: exposure to asbestos history
description: An exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history where the carcinogen is asbestos.

name: exposure to diesel exhaust history
description: An exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history where the carcinogen is diesel exhaust.

name: exposure to chromium history
description: An exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history where the carcinogen is chromium.

name: exposure to silica history
description: An exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history where the carcinogen is silica.

name: indicator of whether an inclusion criterion was met
description: An information content entity that indicates whether or not  an entity has met a specific requirement in order to take part in a given process.

name: indicator of whether all inclusion criteria were met
description: An information content entity  that indicates whether or not  an entity  has met all specific requirements in order to take part in a given process.

name: age of majority inclusion criterion
description: An inclusion criterion that uses the age of majority for a state or institution, where one is generally considered to be an adult, which if met, makes an individual suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: chemotherapy treatment exclusion criterion
description: An exclusion criterion that defines whether chemotherapy was received or is being received for a previous  or current cancer, which when met, makes an individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process

name: radiation treatment exclusion criteria
description: An exclusion criterion that defines whether radiation was received or is being received for a previous  or current cancer, which when met, makes an individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process

name: chemotherapy treatment within the recent past exclusion criterion
description: An exclusion criterion that defines whether chemotherapy was received within a certain timeframe, which when met, makes an individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: radiation treatment within the recent past exclusion criterion
description: An exclusion criterion that defines whether radiation was received within a certain timeframe, which when met, makes an individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: BMI range inclusion criterion
description: An inclusion criterion that defines and states a Body Mass Index range, which if met, makes an individual suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: blood transfusion exclusion criterion
description: An exclusion criterion that is defined by whether the specimen donor received a whole blood transfusion within a specified time frame prior to death, which if met, makes a specimen donor unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: history of metastatic cancer exclusion criterion
description: An exclusion criterion defined as whether an individual has ever been diagnosed with metastatic cancer (cancer that spread beyond the initial site such as to other organs like brain bone or liver), which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: intravenous drug use exclusion criterion
description: An exclusion criterion defined as when an individual has a history of intravenous drug abuse for a specific timeframe, which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: history of sex with someone with a history of blood borne infection  exclusion criterion
description: An exclusion criterion defined  as whether an individual has a history of sex with someone who has been diagnosed or at risk for a blood borne infections disease in a specified time frame, which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: history of sex with someone with a history of intravenous drugs exclusion criterion
description: An exclusion criterion defined  as whether an individual has a history of sex with someone who has used intravenous drugs in a specified time frame, which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: HIV exclusion criterion
description: An exclusion criterion defined  as whether an individual has a history of repeatedly reactive screening assays for HIV-1 or HIV-2 antibody regardless of the results of supplemental assays, which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: exposure to blood borne infectious disease exclusion criterion
description: An exclusion criterion defined  as whether an individual has been exposed to a blood borne infections disease through needle sticks and/or contact with non-intact skin and/or contact with open wounds and/or contact with mucous membranes, which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: RNA interactome capture
description: An assay that identifies RNA binding proteins by cross-linking RNA and proteins with UV light, then purifying the bound complexes by oligo(dT) capture. Finally, the complexes are analyzed by mass spectrometry.

name: widefield microscopy
description: A fluorescence microscopy technique where the specimen under investigation is fully bathed in light, as opposed to confocal microscopy in which only a small portion of the specimen is illuminated.

name: nuclear ligation assay
description: An assay that detects the proximity of chromosomal DNA through the use of a ligation reaction in isolated nuclei.

name: chromosome conformation capture assay
description: A nuclear ligation assay that detects chromosomal interactions between any two genomic loci. Chromatin segments are cross-linked, cut by restriction enzymes, ligated, and finally analyzed by PCR.

name: Hi-C assay
description: A chromosome conformation capture assay that detects genome-wide chromosomal interactions. High-throughput techniques are used to sequence the ligated fragments after cross-linking and cutting with restriction enzymes.

name: physical examination of individual
description: An assay that produces a description of the qualities of an entity that has not been transformed, through observation and physical, non-invasive techniques.

name: hydroxyl-radical footprinting assay
description: A footprinting assay that uses the reaction of hydroxyl radicals with side-chain sites in molecules (proteins, DNA, etc)_ with the resultant mass shift demonstrating the site of modification, used to_ to asses the accessibility of that site.

name: methidiumpropyl-EDTA-iron(II) footprinting assay
description: A footprinting assay that determines protein-binding sites on DNA by partial cleavage of ligand-protected DNA restriction fragments with methidium-propyl-EDTA (MPE). MPE-Fe(II) in the presence of oxygen efficiently catalyzes the non-specific clevage of DNA.

name: measurand role
description: A role borne by a material entity and realized in an assay which achieves the objective to measure the magnitude/concentration/amount of the measurand in the entity bearing evaluant role.

name: transcription start site mapping by primer extension assay
description: A transcription profiling assay in which the transcription start site for a gene is determined by identifying the 5' end of mRNA. A radio-labeled primer is annealed to a complementary mRNA sequence near the 3' end, then cDNA is synthesized until the 5' end is reached.

name: proteomic profiling design
description: A study design in which proteins in a sample are detected, quantified or otherwise analysed.

name: suppression subtractive hybridization
description: An artificially induced nucleic acid hybridization that is performed to compare gene expression in different cell or tissue types based on normalization and suppression, which creates a subtracted cDNA or genomic DNA library.

name: differential screening hybridization
description: An artificially induced nucleic acid hybridization that is performed to identify differentially expressed genes through hybridization of cDNA probes.

name: footprinting assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex
description: A B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody assay that uses a footprinting assay.

name: hydroxyl-radical footprinting assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex
description: A footprinting assay that uses hydroxyl-radical footprinting to measure B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody.

name: ELISA measuring epitope specific interferon-alpha production by T cells
description: An assay of epitope specific interferon-alpha production by T cells that uses an ELISA.

name: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interferon-alpha production by T cells
description: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interferon-alpha production by T cells.

name: health status inclusion criterion
description: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more clinically significant bodily components, dispositions, and/or bodily processes of an entity that are inferred from relevant clinical findings or self-reported, which, if met, makes the entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: clinically relevant lifestyle inclusion criterion
description: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more clinically relevant planned processes that a human being actively participates in , which, if met, makes the human being suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: clinically relevant exposure inclusion criterion
description: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more clinically relevant histories of exposure of an entity, which, if met, makes the entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: gravidity inclusion criterion
description: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more gravidity statuses of an organism, which, if met, makes the entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: precision nuclear run-on sequencing assay
description: An RNA-seq assay that maps the genome-wide distribution of transcriptionally-engaged Pol II at base-pair resolution by using biotin-labeled ribonucleotide triphosphate analogs (biotin-NTP) for nuclear run-on reactions, allowing the efficient affinity purification of nascent RNAs for high throughput sequencing from their 3' ends.

name: chromosome conformation capture-on-chip assay
description: A nuclear ligation assay which uses cross-linking of proteins to proteins and DNA, followed by two rounds of digestion and ligation, inverse PCR, and characterization by microarray or DNA sequencing. This enables unbiased genome-wide screens for DNA contacts made by single genomic sites of interest.

name: genotype phasing by Hi-C assay
description: A genotyping assay in which carbon-copy chromosome conformation is used to detect polymorphism in DNA samples.

name: defined population inclusion criterion
description: An inclusion criterion that is based on fitting within the defined characteristics of a population based study design.

name: BCL format
description: A data format specification that is a binary file containing base calling data. These files are created by sequencing machines during the act of sequencing, and contain data about each of the nucleotide clusters on a sequencing flow cell.

name: ERCC RNA spike-in
description: A processed material developed by the External RNA Controls Consortium (ERCC) that  consists of 92 transcripts, derived and traceable from NIST-certified DNA plasmids.

name: SIRV RNA spike-in
description: A processed material that consists of transcript isoforms of 7 spike-in RNA variant (SIRV) genes and possibly the 92 External RNA Controls Consortium (ERCC) RNA spike-in genes.

name: SRS identifier
description: An accession number that applies to a database record for an individual sample object in an NCBI Sequence Read Archive (SRA) submission. These records are imported from the NCBI BioSample database.

name: age since culture seeding measurement datum
description: An age measurement datum that is the result of the measurement of the age of a cell since cultured (the process of seeding cells onto a culture dish).

name: alignment counting algorithm
description: An algorithm used to assign aligned sequence reads, resulting from a reference genome transcriptome alignment algorithm, to sequence features (e.g. genes or transcripts).

name: alignment counting application
description: A software application that implements an alignment counting algorithm, used to count the overlap of aligned sequencing reads with genes.

name: base calling algorithm
description: An algorithm that assigns nucleotides to temporal or spatial peaks generated by a detector, such as peaks of light intensities generated by a DNA sequencer

name: base calling application
description: A base-calling application that implments a base-calling algorithm to convert BCL (binary base call) files, (e.g., those generated by Illumina sequencing systems) to standard FASTQ file formats for downstream analysis.

name: bcl2fastq software application
description: A base calling application that implments a base calling algorithm to convert BCL (binary base call) files generated by Illumina sequencing systems to standard FASTQ file formats for downstream analysis.

name: date process started
description: A data item that is the date when a process was initiated.

name: dbGaP study identifier
description: A central registered identifier symbol that denotes a specific study in dbGaP.

name: material amplification role
description: A worker role played by the person who runs the enzymatic amplifying process.

name: material sequencing library preparation role
description: A worker role played by the person who performs the library preparation process to generate a sequencing library for a sample to be sequenced.

name: number of PCR cycles during library construction
description: A data item that is the number of PCR cycles used during the construction of a sequencing library.

name: number of rounds of amplification
description: A data item that is the number of times an amplification reaction happened.

name: reference genome role
description: A reference substance role that is played by a reference genome when used during sequence alignment.

name: reference genome-transcriptome alignment algorithm
description: An algorithm that attempts to align a nucleic acid sequence to a reference genome and transcriptome.

name: sequence read length measurement datum
description: A measurement datum that is the result of the measurement of the number of bases in a DNA or RNA sequence.

name: sequencing library input quantity measurement datum
description: A scalar measurement datum that indicates the amount of sequencing library used as input for a sequencer.

name: single-end library
description: A cDNA library that is a collection of short tags from only one end of DNA fragments.

name: specimen harvest quantity
description: A scalar measurement datum that indicates the amount of specimen collected.

name: spike-in dilution factor
description: A data item that indicates the dilution of spike-in added to a specimen.

name: star algorithm
description: A reference genome transcriptome alignment algorithm that is a standalone RNA-seq alignment algorithm that uses uncompressed suffix arrays and a mapping algorithm similar to those used in large-scale genome alignment tools to align RNA-seq reads to a genomic reference.

name: transcript analysis by single-end sequencing assay
description: A sequencing assay that incorporates single-end reads and sequencing technology to determine transcripts, gene structures, and gene expressions.

name: verse algorithm
