description: An alignment counting algorithm that assigns gene features to genomic alignments using a hierarchical assignment scheme, which allows simultaneous quantification of multiple feature types or annotation levels without repeatedly assigning reads.

name: microraft
description: A material separation device also commerically known as Isoraft, that is used to isolate single cells.

name: pipette
description: A device that is a laboratory tool commonly used in chemistry, biology and medicine to transport a measured volume of liquid, often as a media dispenser.

name: differential medium assay
description: an organism identification assay that uses a differential medium to achieve its objective

name: medication time value specification
description: A scalar value specification that specifies the point in time that a human participant under investigation self-administers a medication material

name: medication dose value specification
description: A scalar value specification that specifies the value of the quantity of a material entity administered to an organism as a treatment

name: case role in case-control study
description: A role that is borne by a case-control study design participant under investigation that is associated with the outcome mentioned in the study design.

name: control role in case-control study
description: A role that is borne by a case-control study design participant under investigation that is not associated with the outcome mentioned in the study design.

name: amniotic fluid specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from amniotic fluid.

name: bile specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from bile.

name: cerebrospinal fluid specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from cerbrospinal fluid.

name: feces specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from feces.

name: digestive system fluid or secretion specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from digestive system fluid or secretion.

name: milk specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from milk.

name: pericardial fluid specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from pericardial fluid.

name: saliva specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from saliva.

name: sputum specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from sputum.

name: sweat specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from sweat.

name: synovial fluid specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from synovial fluid.

name: vitreous humor specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from vireous humor.

name: bone marrow specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from bone marrow.

name: placenta specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from placenta.

name: peritoneal fluid specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from peritoneal fluid.

name: pleural fluid specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from pleural fluid.

name: brain specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from brain.

name: hair specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from hair.

name: prostate gland specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from prostate gland.

name: skeletal muscle tissue specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from skeletal muscle.

name: heart specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from heart.

name: renal medulla specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from renal medulla.

name: adrenal gland specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from adrenal gland.

name: breast specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from breast.

name: urinary bladder specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from urinary bladder.

name: tibial artery specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from tibial artery.

name: skin of body specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from skin.

name: pancreas specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from pancreas.

name: stomach specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from stomach.

name: pituitary gland specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from pituitary gland.

name: adipose tissue specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from adipose tissue.

name: cortex of kidney specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from cortex of kidney.

name: esophagus mucosa specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from esophagus mucosa.

name: colon specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from colon.

name: lung specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from lung.

name: esophagus muscularis mucosa specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from esophagus muscularis mucosa.

name: cerebral cortex specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from cerebral cortex.

name: thyroid gland specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from thyroid gland.

name: cerebellum specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from cerebellum.

name: tibial nerve specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from tibial nerve.

name: coronary artery specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from coronary artery.

name: spleen specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from spleen.

name: aorta specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from aorta.

name: atrial appendage specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from the atrium auricular region.

name: esophagogastric junction specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from the esophagogastric junction.

name: ileum specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from ileum.

name: liver specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from liver.

name: minor salivary gland specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from minor salivary gland.

name: omentum specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from omentum.

name: ovary specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from female gonad.

name: sigmoid colon specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from sigmoid colon.

name: suprapubic skin specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from suprapubic skin.

name: testis specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from testis.

name: uterus specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from uterus.

name: vagina specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from vagina.

name: age group inclusion criterion
description: An inclusion criterion that defines and states an age bracket which, if met, makes an entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: minimum age value specification
description: A value specifcation that specifies the youngest age when specifying an age range.

name: maximum age value specification
description: A value specifcation that specifies the oldest age when specifying an age range.

name: use of medication inclusion criterion
description: An inclusion criterion that defines and states a a set of medications, which, if used by an entity, makes that entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: hospital patient inclusion criterion
description: An inclusion criterion defines that a human being has to be a hospital patient to be suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: family status inclusion criterion
description: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more family statuses, which, if met, makes a human being suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: sex inclusion criterion
description: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more sexes which, if met, makes an entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: country of residence inclusion criteria
description: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more countries of residence which, if met, makes a human being suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: ethnicity inclusion criterion
description: An inclusion criteria that defines and states one or more ethnicities which, if met, makes an entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: histopathology assay
description: A histological assay that is intended to check for the presence or level of a specific disease.

name: adapter-sequence trimming
description: A data transformation in which adapter sequences at the end of a molecular sequence are cut (removed).

name: file merge
description: A data transformation in which data contained in 2 or more files are merged into a single file.

name: sequence alignment
description: A data transformation in which one or more sequences (reads) are positioned on a reference sequence template (often a reference set of genes), according to the genetic base-pairing paradigm.

name: sequence data feature count tabulation
description: The counting of features (typically, genes) within aligned sequence data, and organization of these counts into one or more tables.

name: trimmed sequence data
description: The results of a data transformation of sequence data in which (e.g., low quality) read bases are removed, to achieve some specific objective.

name: nCounter Mouse miRNA Expression array
description: A mouse array which is manufacutred by NanoString Technologies. Built upon color-coded molecular barcodes technology, the array profiles miRNA with increased specificity and sensitivty than microarrays.

name: polyA-selected RNA sequencing assay
description: An RNA-seq assay to study transcriptomes through the enrichment of polyadenylated transcripts or removal of ribosomal RNA prior to high-throughput sequencing.

name: polyA-depleted RNA sequencing assay
description: An RNA-seq assay to study non-polyadenylated transcripts, such as, but not exclusive to unspliced and circular isoforms, through the depletion of polyadenylated transcripts prior to high-throughput sequencing.

name: polyA depleted RNA extract
description: A RNA extract that is the output of an extraction process in which RNA molecules lacking poly A tails at thier 3' ends are purified.

name: RNA extraction with polyA depletion
description: A RNA extraction process in which only RNAs lacking a polyA tail are retained

name: isoform sequencing
description: A method for sequencing isoforms by enriching a cDNA library for full-length reads spanning entire transcript isoforms.

name: adapter sequence data
description: Nucleotide sequences of molecules that are ligated to assay samples prior to sequencing of these samples;  these sequences are provided by assay kit manufacturers and typically used to combine sequencing of multiple samples in one assay run.

name: adapter-trimmed sequence data
description: The results of a data transformation of sequence data in which reference subsequences corresponding to ligated library adapters are removed.

name: aligned sequence data
description: The results of a sequence alignment.

name: merged aligned sequence data
description: The results of a data transformation of sequence data in which files containing aligned sequence data are merged together

name: sequence library feature count data
description: The results of a sequence data feature count tabulation.

name: DNA methylation profiling data
description: The results of a DNA methylation profiling assay

name: differential expression analysis data
description: The results of a differential expression analysis.

name: sequence trimming
description: A data transformation in which subsequences of a molecular sequence are cut (removed).

name: digital acquisition card
description: The digital acquisition card acts as the interface between the computer and a measurement device via the computer bus. It converts the signal generated by a measurement device (output from device) to a digital signal via an analog-to-digital converter, ADC. It also converts a digital signal to an analog signal via a digital-to-analog converter, DAC. This analog signal (e.g., stimulus) is fed to a measurement device (input to device).
synonyms: ["DAQ device","digital acquisition and digital generation card"]

name: machine learning
description: A planned process in which statistical techniques are used to give computers the ability to learn about patterns in data, without being explicitly programmed.  Learning is defined in this case as progressively improving performance on a specific task.

name: supervised machine learning
description: A machine learning process using a function that maps an input to an output based on example input-output pairs. It infers a function from labeled training data consisting of a set of training examples.

name: unsupervised machine learning
description: A machine learning process that infers a function describing the structure of \"unlabeled\" data (i.e. data that has not been classified or categorized).

name: molecular interaction identification design
description: A study design that investigates the features of interaction between molecules.

name: colocalization identification design
description: A molecular interaction identification design that investigates the co-occurence and correlation of two or more molecules.

name: genetic interaction identification design
description: A molecular interaction identification design that investigates a phenotype that is the result of two or more genetic perturbations, and is not explained by the individual genetic perturbations alone.

name: functional association identification design
description: A molecular interaction identification design that investigates a relationship that is the result of intermediate steps between two or more molecules that are not necessarily in direct contact with each other.

name: direct interaction identification design
description: A molecular interaction identification design that investigates the influence of molecules, which are in direct contact, on one another.

name: enzymatic reaction identification design
description: A direct interaction identification design that investigations a biological reaction on a molecule which has been triggered by an enzyme.

name: self interaction identification design
description: A molecular interaction identification design that investigates intra-molecular interactions between two or more regions of a single molecule.

name: chromosome conformation capture sequencing assay
description: A chromosome conformation capture-on-chip assay quantitates the products with multiplexed high-throughput sequencing.

name: inverse polymerase chain reaction
description: A polymerase chain reaction which amplifies DNA with only one known sequence from which primers may be designed. A series of restriction digestions and ligations result in a looped DNA fragment which can be primed for PCR.

name: swab specimen
description: A specimen that is stored on a swab as the output of a collecting specimen with swab process.

name: collecting specimen with swab
description: A specimen collection process that uses a swab as the collection device. A swab is an absorbent material (e.g. cotton) on a rod (e.g., wooden stick).

name: demultiplexed sequence data
description: Sequence data in which an identifier subsequence has been used to categorize each reads by source.

name: multiplexed sequence data
description: Sequence data from a sequence library generated from at least two different sources, where each read in the sequence data includes base calls from a multiplex identifier sequence that can be used to trace the source of the read to its source.

name: areolar swab specimen
description: A specimen that is collected with a swab from the surface of an areola of a breast.

name: breast swab specimen
description: A specimen that is collected with a swab from the surface of a breast.

name: cheek swab specimen
description: A specimen that is collected with a swab from the cheek portion of the inside surface of a mouth.

name: nasopharyngeal swab specimen
description: A specimen that is collected with a swab from the surface of a nasopharynx.

name: oral swab specimen
description: A specimen that is collected with a swab from the inside surface of a mouth.

name: oropharyngeal swab specimen
description: A specimen that is collected with a swab from the surface of a oropharynx.

name: rectal swab specimen
description: A specimen that is collected with a swab from the surface of a rectum.

name: tongue swab specimen
description: A specimen that is collected with a swab from the surface of a tongue.

name: vagina swab specimen
description: A specimen that is collected with a swab from the surface of a vagina.

name: fecal swab specimen
description: A specimen that is collected with a swab from the surface of a feces.

name: environmental swab specimen
description: A specimen that is collected with a swab from the surface of an environmenal material.

name: birth cohort study design
description: A cohort study design for which the subjects are followed from the time of birth usually including information about gestation and follow up.

name: disease specific study design
description: A study design for which material and information is collected from subjects that have already developed a particular disease.

name: genealogical record
description: A document about the family relationships of persons related as members of a domestic group linked through descent from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.

name: national registry
description: An information content entity that contains information about a nationwide group of individuals.

name: national biomedical registry
description: A national registry that contains information about individuals that was accumulated for a biomedical purpose, such as diagnoses, treatments, or outcomes.

name: site-directed mutagenesis
description: An induced mutation in which a specific base change is programmed into the sequence of a synthetic primer.

name: random mutagenesis
description: An induced mutation that produces a random mutation, either by introducing the organism to mutagens, or through a process such as error-prone PCR.

name: reconstitution assay
description: An assay in which a cellular process is replicated from the bottom-up using isolated components in order to observe how the components work together.

name: in vitro transcription reconstitution assay
description: A reconstitution assay in which RNA synthesis is investigated using RNA polymerase II transcription systems replicated in vitro from their base components.

name: whole metagenome sequencing assay
description: A DNA sequencing assay that intends to provide information on the DNA sequences of multiple genomes (a metagenome) from different organisms present in the same input sample.

name: case-control study design
description: A study design that entails the creation of two types of roles, such that each participant under investigation bears one or the other. What distinguishes the two types of roles is an 'outcome', which is associated with participants that have the case role but not associated with participants that have the control role. A case-control study examines the hypothesis that the presence of the outcome in case participants is associated with an 'exposure' that is not associated with control participants.

name: gene knockdown
description: A genetic transformation which reduces the expression of a specific gene or genes in an organism.

name: RNAi gene knockdown
description: A gene knockdown that silences genes through artificially-induced RNA interference. This is accomplished by introducing small double-stranded interfering RNA complementary to the target mRNA to be silenced, which is then cleaved by a ribonuclease.

name: ribosomal RNA-depleted RNA extract
description: An extract of RNA which is produced through rRNA (ribosomal RNA) depletion (the removal of highly abundant rRNA species).

name: RNAi knockdown assay
description: A gene knockdown assay in which RNAi gene knockdown is used to disrupt gene transcripts.
synonyms: ["RNA interference knockdown assay","RNAi gene knockdown assay"]

name: direct RNA sequencing assay
description: An assay to study transcription through direct RNA sequence determination, without prior conversion of RNA molecules to cDNA.

name: Illumina NovaSeq 6000
description: A DNA sequencer which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation, with two flow cells and an output of up to 6000 Gb (32-40 B reads per run). The sequencer utilizes synthesis technology and patterned flow cells to optimize throughput and even spacing of sequencing clusters.

name: single-cell RNA sequencing assay
description: An RNA sequencing assay that uses RNA extracts as input that can be traced to a single cell of origin.

name: PacBio Sequel
description: A DNA sequencer built upon single molecule real-time sequencing technology, optimized for generation with long reads and high consensus accuracy, and manufactured by the Pacific Biosciences corporation

name: PacBio Sequel II
description: A DNA sequencer built upon single molecule real-time sequencing technology, optimized for generation of highly accurate (\"\"HiFi\"\") long reads, and which is manufactured by the Pacific Biosciences corporation.

name: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific disease exacerbation resulting from the adoptive transfer of epitope specific antibodies or B cells
description: An efficacy of B cell epitope intervention experiment that uses a disease exacerbation in vivo intervention experiment after adoptive transfer of epitope specific antibodies or B cells.

name: in vivo assay measuring T cell epitope specific disease reduction resulting from the adoptive transfer of epitope specific T cells
description: An efficacy of T cell epitope intervention experiment that detects a decrease in disease after adoptive transfer of epitope specfic T cells.

name: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific disease reduction resulting from adoptive transfer of epitope specific antibodies or B cells
description: An efficacy of B cell epitope intervention experiment that detects a decrease in disease after adoptive transfer of epitope specific antibodies or B cells.

name: in vivo assay measuring T cell epitope specific protection from challenge resulting from the adoptive transfer of epitope specific T cells
description: An efficacy of T cell epitope intervention experiment that uses a epitope protection experiment after adoptive transfer of epitope specfic T cells.

name: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific protection from challenge resulting from adoptive transfer of epitope specific antibodies or B cells
description: An efficacy of B cell epitope intervention experiment that uses a epitope protection experiment after adoptive transfer of epitope specific antibodies or B cells.

name: in vivo assay measuring T cell epitope specific protection from challenge resulting from the adoptive transfer of epitope specific T cells based on pathogen burden
description: A T cell epitope in vivo intervention experiment that uses a epitope protection experiment based on pathogen burden after adoptive transfer of epitope specfic T cells.

name: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific protection from challenge resulting from the adoptive transfer of epitope specific antibodies or B cells based on pathogen burden
description: A B cell epitope in vivo intervention experiment that uses a epitope protection experiment based on pathogen burden after adoptive transfer of epitope specific antibodies or B cells.

name: in vivo assay measuring T cell epitope specific protection from challenge resulting from the adoptive transfer of epitope specific T cells based on survival
description: A T cell epitope in vivo intervention experiment that uses a epitope protection experiment based on survival after adoptive transfer of epitope specfic T cells.

name: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific protection from challenge resulting from the adoptive transfer of epitope specific antibodies or B cells based on survival
description: A B cell epitope in vivo intervention experiment that uses a epitope protection experiment based on survival after adoptive transfer of epitope specific antibodies or B cells.

name: in vivo assay measuring T cell epitope specific protection from tumor challenge resulting from the adoptive transfer of epitope specific T cells
description: A T cell epitope in vivo intervention experiment that uses a epitope protection experiment based on tumor burden after adoptive transfer of epitope specfic T cells.

name: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific protection from tumor challenge resulting from the adoptive transfer of epitope specific antibodies or B cells
description: A B cell epitope in vivo intervention experiment that uses a epitope protection experiment based on tumor burden after adoptive transfer of epitope specific antibodies or B cells.

name: in vivo assay measuring T cell epitope specific tolerance induction resulting from the adoptive transfer of epitope specific T cells
description: An efficacy of T cell epitope intervention experiment that uses a tolerance induction intervention experiment after adoptive transfer of epitope specfic T cells.

name: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific tolerance induction resulting from the adoptive transfer of epitope specific antibodies or B cells
description: An efficacy of B cell epitope intervention experiment that uses a tolerance induction intervention experiment after adoptive transfer of epitope specific antibodies or B cells.

name: Giemsa stain assay
description: An assay that uses a Giemsa stain to characterize cells.

name: individual organism specimen
description: A specimen composed of an individual organism to be studied in an investigation.

name: blood microbiology assay
description: An organism identification assay that identifies a microorganism in a blood specimen.

name: biopsy
description: A specimen collection that obtains a sample of tissue or cell from a living multicellular organism body for diagnostic purposes by means intended to be minimally invasive.

name: image guided biopsy
description: A biopsy which uses an imaging procedure to guide a needle biopsy.
synonyms: ["image guided needle biopsy","image-guided biopsy","imaging guided biopsy"]

name: computed tomography assisted biopsy
description: A needle biopsy guided by real-time computed tomography (CT) scan images.
synonyms: ["Computed Tomography Assisted Biopsy","Computed Tomography-Guided Needle Biopsy","CT Assisted Biopsy","CT Guided Biopsy"]

name: ultrasound-guided needle biopsy
description: A needle biopsy guided by ultrasound visualization.

name: needle biopsy
description: A biopsy that uses a hollow needle to extract cells.

name: fine needle aspiration biopsy
description: A biopsy that uses a thin needle to extract cells.

name: core needle biopsy
description: A biopsy that uses a hollow tube to collect a core of tissue.

name: surgical biopsy
description: A biopsy involving a surgical incision into an organism to access the biopsy material.

name: abdominal wall fat pad biopsy
description: A biopsy involving the collection of a small part of the abdominal wall fat pad.

name: tail biopsy
description: A biopsy involving the collection of the tip of a mamallian tail.

name: bone marrow biopsy
description: A biopsy where a small amount of bone and a small amount of fluid and bone marrow are collected.

name: skinpunch biopsy
description: A biopsy that involves the collection of a cylinder of skin (including epidermis, dermis and superficial fat) using a punch tool.

name: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-15 production by T cells
description: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-15 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.

name: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-16 production by T cells
description: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-16 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.

name: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific induction of hypersensitivity resulting from the adoptive transfer of epitope specific antibodies or B cells
description: An efficacy of B cell epitope intervention experiment that detects a hypersensitivity response by monitoring skin reactions after adoptive transfer of epitope specific antibodies or B cells.

name: in vivo skin test assay measuring T cell epitope specific type IV hypersensitivity resulting from the adoptive transfer of epitope specific T cells
description: An efficacy of T cell epitope intervention experiment that detects epitope specific type IV hypersensitivity after adoptive transfer of epitope specfic T cells.

name: in vivo assay measuring epitope specific proliferation of T cells resulting from the adoptive transfer of epitope specific T cells
description: A T cell epitope specific proliferation assay that is performed in vivo after adoptive transfer of epitope specfic T cells.

name: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific helper T cell enhancement of a B cell mediated immune response resulting from the adoptive transfer of epitope specific T cells
description: A T cell epitope specific helper activity assay that detects the ability of a T cell epitope to enhance an antibody response after adoptive transfer of epitope specfic T cells.

name: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific helper T cell enhancement of a T cell mediated immune response resulting from the adoptive transfer of epitope specific T cells
description: A T cell epitope specific helper activity assay that detects the ability of a T cell epitope to enhance a T cell response after adoptive transfer of epitope specfic T cells.

name: in vivo assay measuring epitope specific T cell killing resulting from the adoptive transfer of epitope specific T cells
description: A T cell epitope specific killing assay that uses an in vivo cell mediated cell killing assay after adoptive transfer of epitope specfic T cells.

name: ELISA measuring epitope specific perforin release by T cells
description: An assay of epitope specific perforin release by T cells that uses an ELISA.

name: enrichment culture medium
description: A culture medium that is designed to favor the growth of a particular microorganism or cells over others, enriching a sample for the microorganism or cells of interest.

name: case series design
description: A study design that samples only subjects who have experienced a particular event (outcome or exposure). Such a design, in contrast to a cohort study, does not permit calculation of absolute risk as non-case subjects are not included.

name: massively parallel reporter assay
description: An assay in which multiplexing the construction and interrogation of larger libraries of reporter constructs allows measurement of the transcriptional regulatory activities of thousands to hundreds of thousands of DNA sequences.

name: in vivo assay measuring a T cell epitope specific response after adoptive transfer of epitope specific T cells
description: An efficacy of T cell epitope intervention experiment that is performed after adoptive transfer of epitope specfic T cells.

name: in vivo assay measuring a B cell epitope specific response after adoptive transfer of epitope specific antibodies or B cells
description: An efficacy of B cell epitope intervention experiment that is performed after adoptive transfer of epitope specific antibodies or B cells.

name: in vivo assay measuring T cell epitope specific disease exacerbation resulting from the adoptive transfer of epitope specific T cells
description: An efficacy of T cell epitope intervention experiment that uses a disease exacerbation in vivo intervention experiment after adoptive transfer of epitope specfic T cells.

name: vacuum-assisted biopsy needle
description: A core biopsy needle integrated with a vacuum system which facilitates the collection of specimen material.

name: pseudovirus entry assay
description: An assay that measures the entry in target cells of reporter viral particles that express an envelope protein of a different virus of interest.
synonyms: ["pseudotype cell entry","pseudotype entry","pseudotyped particle cell entry assay","pseudovirus cell entry"]

name: glass bottle
description: A container with a narrow neck that is made of glass.

name: glass bottle coated with insecticides
description: A glass bottle that coated with material designed to control insects.

name: short interspersed nuclear elements polymerase chain reaction
description: A polymerase chain reaction that amplifies short interspersed nuclear elements (SINEs).

name: nested polymerase chain reaction
description: A polymerase chain reaction with modification intended to reduce non-specific binding in products due to the amplification of unexpected primer binding sites. The nested polymerase chain reaction (PCR) involves the use of two primer sets and two successive PCR reactions. The first set of primers are designed to anneal to sequences upstream from the second set of primers and are used in an initial PCR reaction.

name: immunoelectrophoresis
description: An electrophoresis that separates and characterize proteins based on reaction with antibodies.

name: counter current immunoelectrophoresis
description: An electrophoresis in which antigen and antibody move in opposite directions and form precipitates in the area between the cells where they meet in concentrations of optimal proportions.

name: ligase detection reaction
description: A linear amplification that uses a thermostable ligase to amplify a piece of DNA. Because the enzyme retains activity after multiple thermal cycles, the ligations may be repeated to linearly increase product.

name: loop-mediated isothermal amplification
description: An enzymatic amplification in which a piece of DNA is amplified at a constant temperature of 60 - 65 degree C using either two or three sets of primers and a polymerase with high strand displacement activity in addition to a replication activity. This amplification does not need thermal cyclers and may be a low cost alternative to PCR.

name: detection of pathogenic organisms objective
description: An organism feature identification objective that aims to detect whether an organism contains pathogenic organisms.

name: insecticide resistance detection objective
description: An organism feature identification objective that aims to detect insecticide resistance of an insect.

name: arthropod meal of blood specimen
description: A specimen of the blood ingested by an arthropod.

name: polymerase chain reaction assay
description: An assay that uses polymerase chain reaction technique to amplify DNA.

name: restriction fragment length polymorphism assay
description: An assay that uses digestion of DNA with specific restriction enzymes followed by gel electropheresis to detect differences in the sizes of the generated fragments that are due to genetic differences (polymorphisms) in homologous sequences.
synonyms: ["restriction fragment length polymorphism analysis","RFLP","restriction fragment length polymorphism"]

name: DNA fingerprinting assay
description: An assay to identify a specific individual organism from a DNA specimen by looking at unique patterns in their DNA.

name: insecticide resistance assay
description: An assay that aims to detect the presence and/or frequency of resistance to insecticides in an organism or organism population.

name: insecticide resistance by monitoring known mutations assay
description: An insecticide resistance assay that detects, in a population, presence and frequency of mutant alleles for previously characterized mutations with insecticide resistance phenotypes.

name: insecticide resistance by detecting enzyme activity assay
description: An insecticide resistance assay that is based on determination the catalytic activity of an enzyme associated with insecticide resistance phenotypes.

name: insecticide resistance bioassay
description: An insecticide resistance assay that is typically conducted to measure the effects of a substance on a living organism.

name: insecticide resistance by detecting alpha esterase activity assay
description: An insecticide resistance by detecting enzyme activity assay that measures activity of alpha esterase.

name: insecticide resistance by detecting beta esterase activity assay
description: An insecticide resistance by detecting enzyme activity assay that measures activity of beta esterase.

name: insecticide resistance by detecting acetylcholinesterase activity assay
description: An insecticide resistance by detecting enzyme activity assay that measures activity of acetylcholinesterase.

name: insecticide resistance by detecting glutathione S-transferase activity assay
description: An insecticide resistance by detecting enzyme activity assay that measures activity of glutathione S-transferase (GST).

name: insecticide resistance by detecting carboxylic ester hydrolase activity assay
description: An insecticide resistance by detecting enzyme activity assay that measures activity of carboxylic ester hydrolase using p-nitrophenyl acetate as a substrate.

name: insecticide resistance by detecting mixed-function oxidase assay
description: An insecticide resistance by detecting enzyme activity assay that measures whether mixed-function oxidase activity present.

name: direct insecticide resistance bioassay
description: An insecticide resistance bioassay without the use of any synergist.

name: topical application insecticide resistance bioassay
description: An insecticide resistance bioassay by adding insecticide directly to the thorax of the insect.

name: direct insecticide resistance diagnostic assay
description: A direct insecticide resistance assay that at preset insecticide dosage scoring mortality to determine resistance of a population.

name: insecticide resistance dose response assay
description: A direct insecticide resistance assay in which an insect population is exposed to a range of insecticide dosage scoring mortality to determine resistance.

name: insecticide resistance time response assay
description: A direct insecticide resistance assay to determine resistance as a consequence of the time of exposure to insecticide.

name: Centre for Disease Control and Prevention bottle bioassay
description: A direct insecticide resistance diagnostic assay performs in a glass bottle coated with insecticides for detecting resistance to insecticides in vector populations.

name: WHO cone kit diagnostic assay
description: A direct insecticide resistance diagnostic assay uses WHO cone kit.

name: WHO paper kit diagnostic assay
description: A direct insecticide resistance diagnostic assay uses WHO paper kit.

name: WHO larvicide diagnostic assay
description: A direct insecticide resistance diagnostic assay tests survival of larvae in a medium supplemented with insecticide.

name: insecticide resistance dose response by bottle assay
description: An insecticide resistance dose response assay that performs in a glass bottle coated with insecticides.

name: insecticide resistance dose response by survival of larvae assay
description: An insecticide resistance dose response assay that tests survival of larvae in a medium supplemented with insecticide.

name: insecticide resistance dose response by WHO paper kit assay
description: An insecticide resistance dose response assay using WHO paper kit.

name: insecticide resistance time response by bottle assay
description: An insecticide resistance time response assay that is performed in a glass bottle coated with insecticides, with the presence of a synergist.

name: insecticide resistance time response by WHO paper kit assay
description: An insecticide resistance time response assay using WHO paper kit, with the presence of a synergist.

name: insecticide resistance by amplification refractory mutation system assay
description: An insecticide resistance by monitoring known mutations assay that detects any mutation involving single base changes or small deletions using amplification refractory mutation system (ARMS). The ARMS is based on the use of sequence-specific PCR primers that allow amplification of test DNA only when the target allele is contained within the sample. Following an ARMS reaction the presence or absence of a PCR product is diagnostic for the presence or absence of the target allele. It can be used to analyze human genomic DNA for one or more mutations.

name: insecticide resistance by primer introduced restriction analysis PCR assay
description: An insecticide resistance by monitoring known mutations assay that detects Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms (SNPs) using PCR technique and mismatched primers that is close to the mutation of interest and digested the PCR productions using restriction enzymes.
synonyms: ["PIRA-PCR","polymerase chain reaction-primer-introduced restriction analysis","Primer Introduced Restriction Analysis PCR"]

name: insecticide resistance by nested polymerase chain reaction assay
description: An insecticide resistance by monitoring known mutations assay that detects gene mutation based on nested polymerase chain reaction technique.

name: insecticide resistance by ligase detection reaction assay
description: An insecticide resistance assay that is based on monitoring known mutations using ligase detection reaction exquisitely discriminate between a mismatched and complementary DNA helix.

name: insecticide resistance by ligase detection reaction-fluorescent microsphere assay
description: An insecticide resistance by ligase detection reaction assay that uses fluorescently labeled conserved probes in ligase detection reaction.
synonyms: ["ligase detection reaction-fluorescent microsphere assay","gene mutation detection by LDR-FMA"]

name: insecticide resistance by PCR amplification of specific alleles assay
description: An insecticide resistance assay that is based on monitoring known mutations by PCR amplification of specific alleles to detect polymorphic or mutant alleles.
synonyms: ["allele-specific amplification and amplification refractory mutation system","PCR amplification of specific alleles","PASA"]

name: insecticide resistance by fluorogenic PCR assay
description: An insecticide resistance assay that is based on monitoring known mutations by PCR technique that uses target specific probes labeled with fluorogenic chromophores to detect gene mutation.

name: insecticide resistance by PCR-RELP assay
description: An insecticide resistance by monitoring known mutations assay based on restriction fragment length polymorphism assay.

name: insecticide resistance by short interspersed elements PCR assay
description: An insecticide resistance assay that is based on monitoring known mutations by PCR amplification of short interspersed elements (SINEs).

name: pathogen detection assay
description: An assay that aims to detect pathogens.

name: VectorTest assay
description: A pathogen detection assay that identifies the presence or absence of specific peptide epitopes of circumsporozoite (CS) protein of the most important Plasmodium falciparum and two strains (variants 210 and 247) of the more widespread Plasmodium vivax using a dipstick wicking test strip.

name: pathogen detection by Rapid Analyte Measurement Platform assay
description: A pathogen detection assay that is based on Rapid Analyte Measurement Platform (RAMP) technology to quantify immunologically active substances.

name: pathogen detection by loop-mediated isothermal amplification assay
description: A pathogen detection assay that is based on loop-mediated isothermal amplification.

name: blood meal assay
description: An assay that analyzes the specimen taken from blood meal fed organism, such as insect.

name: blood meal by counter current immunoelectrophoresis assay
description: A blood meal assay that uses a counter current immunoelectrophoresis technique.

name: DNA based blood meal finger printing assay
description: A DNA fingerprinting assay that uses DNA extracted from blood meal fed organism, such as insect.

name: organism identification by size assay
description: An organism identification assay that is based on the size of organism.

name: organism identification by cross mating assay
description: An organism identification assay that is based on genetic crossings between specimens collected in the field to determine whether fertile progeny is produced.

name: organism identification by cytological chromosome examination assay
description: An organism identification assay that is based on analysis of polytene chromosomes through cytological examination of the banding pattern of the species.

name: organism identification by isoenzyme electrophoresis assay
description: An organism identification assay that is based on electrophoresis to determine the isozymes that are present in a specific population to determine the species.

name: organism identification by morphological examination assay
description: An organism identification assay that is based on examination of morphology and the use of specific \"taxonomic keys\" to determine the species of the specimen.

name: organism identification by PCR assay
description: An organism identification assay that is based on PCR.

name: organism identification by specific DNA hybridization assay
description: An organism identification assay that is based on DNA hybrdization.

name: organism identification by salinity tolerance assay
description: An organism identification assay of mosquito species that is on the basis of mosquito survival depending on the salt concentration in the water used to lay their eggs to differentiate between morphologically very similar species.

name: molecular label role
description: A reagent role inhering in a molecular entity intended to associate with some molecular target to serve as a proxy for the presence, abundance, or location of this target in a detection of molecular label assay.

name: molecular label
description: A molecular reagent intended to associate with some molecular target to serve as a proxy for the presence, abundance, or location of this target in a detection of molecular label assay

name: vacuum-assisted biopsy
description: A biopsy performed with a needle augmented with a vacuum device.

name: induced sputum specimen
description: A sputum specimen that is collected from an organism following its inhalation of a nebulized salt solution.

name: passage process
description: A material processing that consists of first growing an organism in an environmental system and then removing the organism to be grown in another environmental system, a process which may be repeated with the objective of altering the organism or increasing its number.

name: passage history record
description: A data item that is about the sequence of environmental systems in each of which is grown an organism in a passage process.

name: Oxford Nanopore MinION
description: A portable DNA sequencer which is manufactured by the Oxford Nanopore Technologies corporation, that uses consumable flow cells producing up to 30 Gb of DNA sequence data per flow cell. The sequencer produces real-time results and utilizes nanopore technology with up to 512 nanopore channels in the sensor array.

name: Oxford Nanopore GridION Mk1
description: A DNA sequencer that is manufactured by the Oxford Nanopore Technologies corporation, that can run and analyze up to five individual flow cells producing up to 150 Gb of data per run. The sequencer produces real-time results and utilizes nanopore technology with the option of running the flow cells concurrently or individually.

name: Oxford Nanopore PromethION
description: A DNA sequencer that is manufactured by the Oxford Nanopore Technologies corporation, capable of running up to 48 flow cells and producing up to 7.6 Tb of data per run. The sequencer produces real-time results and utilizes Nanopore technology, with each flow cell allowing up to 3,000 nanopores to be sequencing simultaneously.

name: PRO-cap
description: Precision nuclear run-on and sequencing to detect Pol II initiation sites

name: cDNA library
description: A collection of DNA molecules with sequences complementary to a specified set of mRNA molecules and commonly developed by enzymatic reverse transcription.

name: ordinal value specification
description: A categorical value specification in which the available categories were created with an explicit order.

name: single-nucleus ATAC-seq
description: An ATAC-seq assay in which single nuclei are isolated from frozen tissue samples, through a protocol designed to maximally preserve nucleus integrity during sample processing and optimize transposase-mediated fragmentation of chromatin in individual nuclei.

name: single-cell ATAC-seq
description: An ATAC assay designed to robustly map the accessible genome of individual cells, using sequencing integrated into a programmable microfluidics platform, in order to provide insights into cell-to-cell variation in accessibility profiles.

name: karyotype information
description: A genetic characteristics information that is about the number and appearance of chromosomes in the nucleus of an eukaryotic cell.

name: partial karyotype information
description: A karyotype information that is about the structural variation of partial genome rather than whole genome.

name: full karyotype information
description: A karyotype information that is about the structural variation of the whole genome.

name: presence or over-threshold value specification
description: An ordinal value specification that indicates that either  a) an analyte or mesaurand is present in an evaluant, or  b) that the amount of analyte/measurand detected is over some predetermined threshold.

name: single-value binding of antibody with reporter to antigen assay
description: An assay that detects the linking of antigens and antibodies via special signaling mechanisms, such as EIA, ELISA, chemiluminescence, etc. that produces one measure (quantitative or qualitative) of the analyte of interest

name: platelet-poor plasma specimen
description: A blood plasma specimen that is the output of some platelet-poor plasma preparation and is the portion of plasma that contains fewer than 10,000 platelets per microliter.

name: platelet-poor plasma preparation process
description: A material component separation process in which (1) whole blood is first centrifuged to separate red blood cells from blood plasma, which forms the supernatant, and (2) the blood plasma is then centrifuged to separate platelets from the plasm.

name: tracheal aspirate specimen
description: A specimen that is collected with a suctioning tube from the trachea.

name: mid-turbinate nasal swab specimen
description: A specimen that is collected with a mid-turbinate nasal swab from the turbinate area of the nasal cavity.

name: nasal aspirate specimen
description: A specimen that is collected with a suctioning tube from the nasal cavity.

name: lower respiratory tract aspirate specimen
description: A specimen that is collected with a suctioning tube from the lower respiratory tract.

name: upper respiratory specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from the upper respiratory tract

name: lower respiratory tract specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from the lower respiratory tract.

name: anterior nasal swab specimen
description: A specimen that is derived from the anterior nasal wall

name: aspiration specimen collection
description: Procedure using suction, usually with a thin needle and syringe, to remove bodily fluid or tissue.

name: personal protective device
description: A device which is a wearable garment designed to protect the wearer's body from injury or infection.

name: face mask
description: A personal protective device worn over the nose and mouth as a respiratory filter to inhibit the flow of particles.

name: non-medical mask
description: A face mask not manufactured according to medical equipment standards.

name: medical mask
description: A face mask manufactured according to a recognized medical equipment standard.

name: N95 respirator
description: A face mask that meets the U.S. National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health (NIOSH) N95 classification of air filtration, meaning that it filters at least 95% of incoming airborne particles.

name: face shield
description: A personal protective device used to protect the wearer's entire face (or part of it) from hazards such as flying objects and road debris, chemical splashes, or alternately potentially infectious materials.

name: patient gown
description: A personal protective clothing item which is a gown designed for use by a patient to facilitate caregiving by medical staff.

name: scrubs
description: A personal protective clothing item which is sterilized and which is worn by a health care professional.  It can reference a shirt and pants or dress, and depending on medical protocol, may include a medical cap.

name: reusable patient gown
description: A patient gown intended to be reused after being laundered.

name: disposable patient gown
description: A patient gown intended for a single period of continuous use and then disposed of.

name: medical gown
description: A personal protective clothing item which is a gown worn by a medical professional in order to provide a barrier between patient and professional.

name: apron
description: A garment which is worn over other clothing and covers mainly the front of the body.

name: surgical gown
description: A medical gown which is subjected to a sterilization process and which is intended to be worn by a medical professional during surgical procedures.

name: personal protective glove
description: A personal protective device which is a glove.

name: personal protective clothing item
description: A personal protective device which consists of a garment that serves in place of or in addition to regular body clothing.

name: laboratory coat
description: A personal protective clothing item which is an overcoat worn by medical or laboratory professionals.

name: medical glove
description: A personal protective glove which is disposable and is used during medical examinations and procedures to help prevent cross-contamination between caregivers and patients.

name: nitrile glove
description: A personal protective glove which is made out of nitrile rubber.

name: transparent droplet barrier
description: A device which is a transparent constructed barrier, usually made out of acrylic (Plexiglass) or polycarbonate plastic, installed in facilities to intercept respiratory droplets, encourage physical distancing requirements.

name: footwear cover
description: A personal protective device which is an impermiable material which covers a shoe or boot in order to prevent spread of specific environmental contaminants.

name: disposable footwear cover
description: A footwear cover which is designed for a single period of continuous use and then disposed of.

name: reusable footwear cover
description: A footwear cover which is designed for repeated use.

name: surgical N95 respirator
description: A N95 respirator which has been approved by the FDA as a surgical mask.

name: protective coverall
description: A personal protective clothing item which is a loose fitting coverall for ease of movement, with sleeves, full leggings and often a hood to cover the head. These can also include overshoe pieces to cover footwear and protect against contamination.

name: protective sleeve
description: A personal protective clothing item which is a protective cover worn over the arm.

name: protective apron
description: A personal protective clothing item which is an apron.

name: medical cap
description: A personal protective device which is worn on the head that helps prevent transmission of contaminants contained in hair and scalp.

name: specimen collection device
description: A container used to collect a specimen.

name: specimen pad
description: A sample collection device consisting of a soft flexible, absorbent pad usually made from natural material such as gauze or cotton, used to absorb specimen fluid or particulate matter.

name: specimen collection swab stick
description: A specimen collection device which is a specimen pad attached to a long handle used to collect specimen material.

name: cotton swab
description: A device which is a cotton pad mounted on one or both ends of a stick.

name: drag swab
description: A specimen collection device consisting of a specimen pad made of sterile gauze which is aseptically attached to a pole by clips or to a string

name: pre-moistened swab stick
description: A specimen collection swab stick that is pre-moistened with liquid prior to sampling.

name: surface wipe
description: A sample collection device consisting of a thin, less absorbent sheet, used to collect material from surfaces.

name: surveillance process
description: An investigation in which some entity is monitored, and data concerning that entity collected, interpreted, and disseminated, for the purpose of managing, directing, or protecting that entity, or some other entity.

name: cluster study group role
description: A study group role that is the result of the allocation of a cluster of study-defined groupings of people in a clinical trial to receive a specific intervention/treatment, or no intervention, according to the trial's protocol.

name: compound study group role
description: A study group role that is the result of the allocation of a compound of geographically-proximate households with a shared component in a clinical trial to receive a specific intervention/treatment, or no intervention, according to the trial's protocol.

name: ultraviolet light source
description: A light source that provides ultraviolet (UV) light for use in a distant area using a delivery system.

name: visible light source
description: A light source that provides visible light for use in a distant area using a delivery system.

name: solar light source
description: A light source that light is produced from solar energy.

name: adult arthropod specimen collection process
description: A live arthropod specimen collection process in which the arthropods are in the adult stage.

name: animal-biting arthropod specimen collection by aspiration
description: An arthropod specimen collection by aspiration that occurs while the arthropod is biting an animal.

name: animal-biting outdoor arthropod specimen collection by aspiration
description: An animal-biting arthropod specimen collection by aspiration that occurs outside a building.

name: aquatic arthropod specimen collection process
description: An arthropod specimen collection process that has the objective of collecting mosquitoes from an aquatic environment.

name: arthropod resting in animal house specimen collection by aspiration
description: An arthropod specimen collection by aspiration that catches specimens resting inside an animal house.

name: arthropod resting outdoors on artificial support specimen collection by aspiration
description: An arthropod resting outdoors specimen collection by aspiration that occurs while the arthropod rests on a processed material such as a wall or furniture.

name: arthropod resting outdoors on natural support specimen collection by aspiration
description: An arthropod resting outdoors specimen collection by aspiration that occurs while the arthropod rests on an unprocessed material such as a plant.

name: arthropod resting outdoors specimen collection by aspiration
description: An animal-biting arthropod specimen collection by aspiration that occurs while the arthropod is resting outside a building during a period of inactivity.

name: arthropod specimen collection by aspiration
description: A live arthropod specimen collection process that involves the use of an aspirator, a device which draws an arthropod by suction into a container.

name: arthropod specimen collection process
description: A specimen collection process that has the objective of collecting arthropods as specimens.

name: human-biting arthropod specimen collection by aspiration
description: An arthropod specimen collection by aspiration that occurs while the arthropod is biting a human.

name: human-biting indoor arthropod specimen collection by aspiration
description: An arthropod specimen collection by aspiration that occurs while the arthropod is biting a human inside a building.

name: human-biting outdoor arthropod specimen collection by aspiration
description: An arthropod specimen collection by aspiration designed to catch specimens that are in the process of biting a human outside a building.

name: knockdown arthropod specimen collection by pyrethrum spray
description: A knockdown arthropod specimen collection process in which the pesticide is pyrethrum.

name: knockdown arthropod specimen collection process
description: An arthropod specimen collection process that involves exposing arthropods to pesticide, then collecting them once they become dead or immobilized.

name: live arthropod specimen collection process
description: An arthropod specimen collection process meant to collect live specimens.

name: arthropod trap
description: A device designed to catch arthropods.

name: artificial pit shelter
description: An arthropod trap, consisting of a pit dug in the ground to provide a space for arthropods to rest and be collected.

name: baited net trap
description: An arthropod trap designed to work with an animal (which could be human) inside a netted structure. This structure is designed so that an arthropod, attracted by the animal, can fly into the netted structure but can neither escape nor reach the animal.

name: barrier trap
description: An arthropod trap consisting of a static physical barrier designed to funnel arthropods in flight into a container.

name: BG-Counter
description: A device manufactured by BioGents that is designed to count mosquitoes passing through the device, differentiating the mosquitoes from other arthropods.

name: BG-Sentinel trap
description: An arthropod trap that is manufactured by Biogents and is designed to attract arthropods through the use of a motorized fan to mimic convection currents produced by a human. The current also pulls arthropods into the trap, where a layer of gauze prevents the arthropods from escaping along with the air current.

name: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention light trap
description: A light trap that is designed to use motorized suction to trap arthropods in a collection bag once they approach the light attractant. This trap is also designed to be lightweight and operate in environments in which electricity may be scarce.

name: dipper for arthropod immatures
description: A device that is designed for the collection of arthropod larvae or pupae from water and has the shape of a ladle or a pan.

name: encephalitis virus surveillance trap
description: A light trap that uses carbon dioxide as attractant. The trap consists of a container of dry ice with holes in the bottom to allow the carbon dioxide to flow downward into a separate container, in which a motorized fan creates suction to collect arthropods.

name: gravid trap
description: An arthropod trap that is designed to collect gravid female arthropods or their eggs.

name: light trap
description: An arthropod trap that uses light as an attractant.

name: light trap for indoor use
description: A light trap designed to be placed inside a building.

name: light trap for outdoor use
description: A light trap designed to be placed outside a building.

name: Mosquito Magnet trap
description: An arthropod trap that is powered by propane and is designed to emit a combination of carbon dioxide, heat, water, and oct-1-en-3-ol attractants while simultaneously using suction to trap arthropods.

name: MosquiTRAP
description: A gravid trap consisting of an arthropod attractant and adhesive surface.

name: New Jersey light trap
description: A light trap that is designed to use motorized suction to trap arthropods in a collection bag once they approach the light attractant.

name: Onderstepoort Veterinary Institute light-suction trap
description: A light trap that is designed to use motorized suction to trap arthropods in a collection bag once they approach the attractant. The light is supplied by an 8 watt tube, and the fan providing the suction has an 11-centimeter diameter.

name: outlet window trap
description: An arthropod trap that is positioned adjacent to a window of a building and is designed to collect arthropods flying out of the building.

name: ovitrap
description: An arthropod trap that consists of a container holding a mesh layer above water and is designed to trap arthropods hatched from eggs dropped over the water by gravid females.

name: resting arthropod trap
description: An arthropod trap that is designed to be attractive to an arthropod as a place to rest during a period of inactivity.

name: resting box trap
description: An arthropod trap that consists of a box that is open on one end. The placement of the box and modifications to it are done in such a way that it becomes attractive to an arthropod as a place to rest during a period of inactivity.

name: resting bucket
description: An arthropod trap that consists of a bucket, which is lined with fabric and placed on its side, and a wet cloth inside the bucket. The placement of the box and modifications to it are done in such a way that it becomes attractive to an arthropod as a place to rest during a period of inactivity (not actively seeking a host).

name: Shannon trap
description: An arthropod trap that is made of cloth and netting and is designed to be suspended from above (e.g. from a tree). It is also designed so that the arthropod enters the trap from beneath, being attracted to some bait, and is prevented from escaping upward by the suspended cloth, which allows them to be collected from the upper interior of the trap.

name: sticky resting bucket
description: An arthropod trap that consists of a bucket, which is lined with adhesive and placed on its side, and a wet cloth inside the bucket. The placement of the box and modifications to it are done in such a way that it becomes attractive to an arthropod as a place to rest during a period of inactivity. The trap is designed for arthropods to become caught in the adhesive so that they can be collected.

name: sticky trap
description: An arthropod trap that is designed to capture arthropods resting on a surface by coating the surface with adhesive.

name: population based design
description: A study design where the selection of the individuals that are included into the study are intended to be representative of all individuals in the a priori defined specific population and is done at the population level or among the population groups, generally to find the cause, incidence or spread of the disease or to see the response to the treatment, nutrition or environment.

name: endotracheal tube specimen
description: A specimen that derives from a biofilm that forms on the inner surface of an endotracheal tube while the tube is in the trachea. The specimen is collected upon removal of the tube from the trachea.

name: endotracheal aspirate specimen
description: A specimen that derives from a biofilm that forms on the inner surface of an endotracheal tube while the tube is in the trachea. The specimen is collected by suction without removing the tube.

name: input protein sequence start site
description: The position of the first amino acid in a protein sequence being analyzed (input protein sequence).

name: input protein sequence stop site
description: The position of the last amino acid in a protein sequence being analyzed (input protein sequence).

name: input gene sequence start site
description: The position of the first nucleotide in a gene sequence being analyzed (input gene sequence).

name: input gene sequence stop site
description: The position of the last nucelotide in a gene sequence being analyzed (input gene sequence).

name: reference protein sequence start site
description: The position of the first amino acid in a reference protein sequence (sequence being used for comparison).

name: reference protein sequence stop site
description: The position of the last amino acid in a reference protein sequence (sequence being used for comparison).

name: reference gene sequence start site
description: The position of the first nucleotide in a reference gene sequence (sequence being used for comparison).

name: reference gene sequence stop site
description: The position of the last nucelotide in a reference sequence (sequence being used for comparison).

name: altitude measurement datum
description: A length measurement datum between a point at sea or ground level and some point above it.

name: capture Hi-C assay
description: A Hi-C assay in which a selection step is performed on ligated fragments in order to enrich for ligation products containing specific regions of interest.

name: magnetic resonance imaging assay
description: An imaging assay in which nuclear magnetic resonance is used to produce information about the interior structure and composition of an input material entity.

name: computed tomography imaging assay
description: An imaging assay that uses a series of X-ray images to produce information about the interior structure and composition of an input material entity.

name: positron emission tomography imaging assay
description: An imaging assay in which positron-emitting radionuclides are used to visualize functional processes of an input material entity.

name: specimen collection duration
description: A time measurement datum that is the count of collection cycles over which a specimen collection process occurs.

name: material supplier
description: A person or organization that provides material supplies to other people or organizations.

name: T cell receptor repertoire sequencing assay
description: A sequencing assay that determines the sequences of DNA or RNA molecules that encode the repertoire of T cell receptors within an input sample.

name: B cell receptor repertoire sequencing assay
description: A sequencing assay that determines the sequence of a DNA or RNA molecules that encode the repertoire of B cell receptors within an input sample.
synonyms: ["Antibody repertoire sequencing assay","BCR repertoire sequencing assay"]

name: prevalence of pathogen in specimens
description: A data item that is the frequency of detection of a specified pathogenic organism in collected specimens.

name: prevalence of blood meal specimens from a host organism
description: A data item that is the frequency of blood whose source is from a specified host organism in collected blood meal specimens.

name: presence of blood from host organism in blood meal specimen
description: A data item that indicates whether blood in a blood meal specimen came from a specified host organism.

name: blood meal source organism
description: An organism that is the source of a blood meal.

name: blood meal source role
description: A role borne by an organism that is gained during a process in which another organism ingests blood as food from the organism.

name: arthropod attractor role
description: A role of a material entity realized in drawing an arthropod in the direction of the material.

name: arthropod collection process with automated identification
description: An arthropod specimen collection process that involves a device that produces data specifying the types of arthropod collected.

name: gravid female arthropod specimen collection process
description: An arthropod specimen collection process that has the objective of collecting gravid female arthropods.

name: resting flight-capable arthropod specimen collection process
description: An arthropod specimen collection process that occurs while an arthropod that is capable of flight is resting outdoors during a period of inactivity.

name: daytime arthropod specimen collection by aspiration
description: An arthropod specimen collection by aspiration that occurs in the daytime.

name: arthropod resting in human house specimen collection by aspiration
description: An arthropod specimen collection by aspiration that catches specimens resting inside a human house.

name: landing arthropod specimen collection process
description: An arthropod specimen collection process that occurs while the arthropods land on a surface.

name: flying adult arthropod collection process by passive interception
description: An adult arthropod specimen collection process that has the objective of collecting arthropods capable of flight, through the use of a barrier trap.

name: device for resting of adult arthropods for collection
description: A device that is designed to provide a solid surface that is attractive to an arthropod as a place to rest during a period of inactivity.

name: well net for arthropod immatures
description: A device that is designed for the collection of arthropod larvae or pupae from water and consists of a conical net.

name: arthropod trap containing small non-human animal bait
description: An arthropod trap that uses as attractant an animal that is not human and is the size of a chicken or smaller.

name: trap for emerging adult arthropods
description: An arthropod trap that is designed to trap an arthropod as it emerges from water at the beginning of its adult stage.

name: ferritin assay
description: An assay that measures ferritin

name: fibrinogen assay
description: An assay that measures fibrinogen

name: iron assay
description: An analyte assay that measures the abundance of iron

name: ionized calcium assay
description: An analyte assay that measures the abundance of ionized calcium

name: transferrin assay
description: An analyte assay that measures the abundance of transferrin

name: uric acid assay
description: An analyte assay that measures the abundance of uric acid

name: globulin assay
description: An analyte assay that measures the abundance of globulin

name: myelocyte assay
description: A cytometry assay that measures the abundance and/or characteristics of myelocytes

name: metamyelocyte assay
description: A cytometry assay that measures the abundance and/or characteristics of metamyelocytes

name: hematocrit assay
description: A cytometry assay that measures the proportion of red blood cells

name: promyelocyte assay
description: A cytometry assay that measures the abundance and/or characteristics of promyelocytes

name: basophil assay
description: A cytometry assay that measures the abundance and/or characteristics of basophils

name: neutrophil assay
description: A cytometry assay that measures the abundance and/or characteristics of neutrophils

name: eosinophil assay
description: A cytometry assay that measures the abundance and/or characteristics of eosinophils

name: lymphocyte assay
description: A cytometry assay that measures the abundance and/or characteristics of lymphocytes

name: monocyte assay
description: A cytometry assay that measures the abundance and/or characteristics of monocytes

name: reticulocyte assay
description: A cytometry assay that measures the abundance and/or characteristics of reticulocytes

name: macrophage assay
description: A cytometry assay that measures the abundance and/or characteristics of macrophages

name: platelet assay
description: A cytometry assay that measures the abundance and/or characteristics of platelets

name: injection function
description: The function of a device realized when administering a substance in vivo, applied particularly to the forcible insertion of a liquid or gas by means of a syringe, pump, etc.

name: Epstein Barr virus transformed B cell
description: A material entity which results from viral transformation process using EBV as transformation agent when applied to B-cell entity

name: chimera
description: An organism which contains cells or tissues with a different genotype

name: obsolete_anatomical entity
description: An anatomical entity is a material entity that is part of a multicellular organism, and which is large enough so that it forms an identifiable structure in the organism. Specifically, it excludes granular parts of the organism, such as atoms, molecules, cells, which can be removed from the organism without affecting it. It is defined as the union of 'multi-tissue structure', 'body substance' and 'portion of tissue'

name: blood plasma specimen
description: a material entity which corresponds to the liquid component of blood, in which the blood cells are suspended.

name: blood serum specimen
description: A material entity which derives from blood and corresponds to blood plasma without fibrinogen or the other clotting factors.

name: organism
description: A material entity that is an individual living system, such as animal, plant, bacteria or virus, that is capable of replicating or reproducing, growth and maintenance in the right environment. An organism may be unicellular or made up, like humans, of many billions of cells divided into specialized tissues and organs.

name: obsolete_immortal cell
description: a cell derived from a multicellular organism that has the potential to replicate indefinitely

name: obsolete_fragment derived from protein
description: A material entity which is derived from a  protein

name: phosphate buffered saline solution
description: Phosphate buffered saline (abbreviated PBS) is a buffer solution commonly used in biochemistry. It is a salty solution containing sodium chloride, sodium phosphate and in some preparations potassium chloride and potassium phosphate. The buffer helps to maintain a constant pH. The concentration usually matches the human body (isotonic).

name: specimen
description: A material entity that has the specimen role.

name: obsolete_cell line cell
description: A material entity that represents generations of a primary culture.

name: obsolete_immortal cell line culture
description: A cell line that is expected to be capable of indefinite propagation in an vitro culture.

name: xenograft
description: A material entity which results from the transplantation of living cells, tissues or organs  from on organism of one species to an organism of another species.

name: cultured cell population
description: A processed material comprised of a collection of cultured cells that has been continuously maintained together in culture and shares a common propagation history.

name: primary cultured cell population
description: A cultured cell population comprised of cells expanded directly from living tissue prior to being passaged.

name: obsolete_cell line
description: A secondary cultured cell population that represents a genetically stable and homogenous population of cultured cells that shares a common propagation history (ie has been successively passaged together in culture).

name: cultured clonal cell population
description: A cultured cell population comprised of cells which can all be traced back to a single ancestor cell, and which therefore can be treated as identical.

name: screening library
description: a screening library is a collection of materials engineered to identify qualities of a subset of its members during a screening process?

name: synthetic peptide
description: a synthetic peptide is an material entity which is artificially engineered and results from the synthesis of a chain of amino acids which may also be found in natural protein and be identical in sequence to a protein fragment

name: organ section
