name: chromium release assay
description: An in vitro cell killing assay in which radioactive chromium is absorbed by cells and released into supernatant when the cells die. The amount of radioactivity measured in the supernatant is a proxy for the number of cells that have died.

name: clinical history
description: A series of statements representing health-relevant qualities of a patient and of a patient's family.

name: phenotype
description: A (combination of) quality(ies) of an organism determined by the interaction of its genetic make-up and environment that differentiates specific instances of a species from other instances of the same species.

name: disease
description: A disposition (i) to undergo pathological processes that (ii) exists in an organism because of one or more disorders in that organism.

name: disease course
description: The totality of all processes through which a given disease instance is realized.

name: diagnosis
description: The representation of a conclusion of a diagnostic process.

name: treatment
description: A planned process whose completion is hypothesized by a health care provider to eliminate, prevent, or alleviate a disorder, the signs and symptoms of a disorder, or a pathological process

name: fixed tissue specimen
description: A processed specimen that is the output of a fixation process.

name: fixed tissue slide specimen
description: A fixed tissue specimen that is placed in a slide.

name: health care provider role
description: A human health care role inhering in an organization or human being that is realized by a process of providing health care services to an organism.

name: age
description: A time quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of how long the bearer has existed.

name: fluorescence
description: A luminous flux quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's emitting longer wavelength light following the absorption of shorter wavelength radiation; fluorescence is common with aromatic compounds with several rings joined together.

name: composition
description: A single physical entity inhering in an bearer by virtue of the bearer's quantities or relative ratios of subparts.

name: concentration of
description: A quality inhering in a substance by virtue of the amount of the bearer's there is mixed with another substance.

name: biological sex
description: An organismal quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's ability to undergo sexual reproduction in order to differentiate the individuals or types involved.

name: morphology
description: A quality of a single physical entity inhering in the bearer by virtue of the bearer's size or shape or structure.

name: size
description: A morphology quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's physical magnitude.

name: length
description: A 1-D extent quality which is equal to the distance between two points.

name: mass
description: A physical quality that inheres in a bearer by virtue of the proportion of the bearer's amount of matter.

name: position
description: A spatial quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's spatial location relative to other objects in the vicinity.

name: structure
description: A morphology quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's relative position, shape, arrangements and connectivity of an organism's various parts; the pattern underlying its form.

name: temperature
description: A physical quality of the thermal energy of a system.

name: time
description: A quality in which events occur in sequence.

name: viability
description: An organismal quality inhering in a bearer or a population by virtue of the bearer's disposition to survive and develop normally or the number of surviving individuals in a given population.

name: behavioral quality
description: An organismal quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's behavior aggregate of the responses or reactions or movements in a given situation.

name: female
description: A biological sex quality inhering in an individual or a population that only produces gametes that can be fertilised by male gametes.

name: male
description: A biological sex quality inhering in an individual or a population whose sex organs contain only male gametes.

name: volume
description: A 3-D extent quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's amount of 3-dimensional space it occupies.

name: physical quality
description: A quality of a physical entity that exists through action of continuants at the physical level of organisation in relation to other entities.

name: damage
description: A structural quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of whether the bearer has been harmed or injured or spoiled.

name: pressure
description: A physical quality that inheres in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's amount of force per unit area it exerts.

name: diluted
description: A concentration which relatively low.

name: damaged
description: A structural quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer being harmed or injured or spoiled, such that its functionality is impaired.

name: lateral to
description: A spatial quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being located toward the side relative to another entity.

name: ventral to
description: A spatial quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being located toward the abdomen of an organism relative to another entity.

name: dorsal to
description: A spatial quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being located toward the back or upper surface of an organism relative to another entity.

name: physical object quality
description: A quality which inheres in a continuant.

name: electromagnetic (EM) radiation quality
description: A physical quality that inheres in an bearer by virtue of how that bearer interacts with electromagnetic radiation.

name: luminous flux
description: A scalar optical quality which obtains by the magnitude of the light emitted by the bearer.

name: optical quality
description: An EM radiation quality in which the EM radiation is within the fiat range of the spectrum visible deemed to be light.

name: bacterial mating type
description: A mating type that indicates whether the F plasmid has integrated into the chromosome.

name: yeast mating type
description: A yeast mating type.

name: mixed sex
description: A biological sex quality inhering in a population of multiple sexes.

name: biomaterial purity
description: A composition quality inhering in an bearer by virtue of the bearer's homogeneity of a biomaterial.

name: hermaphrodite
description: A biological sex quality inhering in an organism or a population with both male and female sexual organs in one individual.

name: a mating type (yeast)
description: A S. cerevisiae mating type cells that secrete a pheromone that in alpha haploids stimulates processes that lead to mating.

name: Saccharomyces cerevisiae mating type
description: A S. cerevisiae mating type.

name: Schizosaccharomyces pombe mating type
description: A S. pombe mating type determined by the gene configuration on the mat1 locus.

name: alpha mating type (yeast)
description: A S. cerevisiae mating type cells that secrete a pheromone that stimulates a haploids.

name: h minus
description: A S. pombe mating type determined by the mat1-Mc and mat1-Mi on the mat1 locus.

name: h plus
description: A S. pombe mating type determined by the mat1-Pc and mat1-Pi on the mat1 locus.

name: F mating type
description: A bacterial mating type indicating the presence of F plasmid in a bacterial cell.

name: F minus mating type
description: A bacterial mating type indicating the absence of F plasmid in a bacterial cell.

name: ploidy
description: A cellular quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's number of homologous sets of chromosomes in the nucleus or primary chromosome-containing compartment of the cell, each set essentially coding for all the biological traits of the organism.

name: haploid
description: A ploidy quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's containing a single set of homologous chromosomes.

name: polyploid
description: A ploidy quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's containing more than two homologous sets of chromosomes.

name: aneuploid
description: A ploidy quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's containing a non-integral multiple of the monoploid number, due to extra or missing chromosomes.

name: euploid
description: A ploidy quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's containing an integral multiple of the monoploid number, possibly excluding the sex-determining chromosomes.

name: diploid
description: A ploidy quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's having two copies (homologs) of each chromosome, usually one from the mother and one from the father.

name: cellular quality
description: A monadic quality of continuant that exists at the cellular level of organisation.

name: alive
description: A viability quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's condition before death.

name: dead
description: A viability quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the cessation of the bearer's life.

name: quality of a solid
description: A physical quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's exhibiting the physical characteristics of an entity characterized by particles arranged such that their shape and volume are relatively stable.

name: quality of a gas
description: A physical quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's exhibiting the physical characteristics of an entity consisting of particles that have neither a defined volume nor defined shape.

name: quality of a liquid
description: A physical quality inhering in an entity exhibiting the physical characteristics of an amorphous (non-crystalline) form of matter between a gas and a solid that has a definite volume, but no definite shape.

name: flow rate
description: A physical quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's motion characteristic.

name: anterior to
description: A spatial quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being located toward the front of an organism relative to another entity.

name: 3-D extent
description: A size quality inhering in an bearer by virtue of the bearer's extension in three dimensions.

name: radiation quality
description: A quality that inheres in an bearer by virtue of how that bearer interacts with radiation.

name: activity (of a radionuclide)
description: A radiation quality inhering in a radioactive substance by virtue of its transformation (disintegration) rate.

name: radioactive
description: A radiation quality inhering in bearer by virtue of the bearer's exhibiting or being caused by radioactivity.

name: left side of
description: A spatial quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being located on left side of from the a another entity.

name: right side of
description: A spatial quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being located on right side of a another entity.

name: phenotypic sex
description: An organismal quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's physical expression of sexual characteristics.

name: mating type
description: A biological sex quality inhering in an individual or a population that undergo sexual reproduction.

name: movement quality
description: A physical quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's participation in movement.

name: frozen
description: A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being kept below its freezing point.

name: organismal quality
description: A quality that inheres in an entire organism or part of an organism.

name: population quality
description: A quality that inheres in an entire population or part of a population.

name: osmolality
description: A concentration quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's amount of osmoles of solute per kilogram of solvent.

name: molecular quality
description: A quality which inheres in a molecular entity, a single molecule, atom, ion, radical etc.

name: quality of a substance
description: A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of its constitution.

name: handedness
description: A behavioral quality inhering ina bearer by virtue of the bearer's unequal distribution of fine motor skill between its left and right hands or feet.

name: left handedness
description: Handedness where the organism preferentially uses the left hand or foot for tasks requiring the use of a single hand or foot or a dominant hand or foot.

name: right handedness
description: Handedness where the organism preferentially uses the right hand or foot for tasks requiring the use of a single hand or foot or a dominant hand or foot.

name: ambidextrous handedness
description: Handedness where the organism exhibits no overall dominance in the use of right or left hand or foot in the performance of tasks that require one hand or foot or a dominant hand or foot.

name: fluid flow rate
description: A physical quality inhering in a fluid (liquid or gas) by virtue of the amount of fluid which passes through a given surface per unit time.

name: protein
description: An amino acid chain that is produced de novo by ribosome-mediated translation of a genetically-encoded mRNA, and any derivatives thereof.

name: CD4 molecule
description: A protein that is a translation product of the human CD4 gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof. CD4 is an accessory protein for MHC class-II antigen/T-cell receptor interaction. It is the primary receptor for HIV-1. CD4 has four immunoglobulin-like domains in its extracellular region that share the same structure, but can differ in sequence.

name: CD3 subunit with immunoglobulin domain
description: A protein with a core domain composition consisting of an extracellular N-terminal domain that adopts an immunoglobulin fold, a transmembrane domain, and an intracellular C-terminal domain with a single copy of the Immunoreceptor tyrosine-based activation motif (Pfam:PF02189) (ITAM). It constitutes the invariant subunit of the T cell antigen receptor (TCR). TCR is a surface receptor on T cells responsible for recognizing MHC-restricted antigens and initiating the cellular immune response.

name: prostate-specific antigen
description: A protein that is a translation product of the human KLK3 gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

name: antithrombin-III
description: A serpin that is a translation product of the human SERPINC1 gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

name: double-stranded RNA-specific adenosine deaminase
description: A protein that is a translation product of the human ADAR gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

name: albumin
description: A protein that is a translation product of the human ALB gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

name: beta-2-microglobulin
description: A protein that is a translation product of the human B2M gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

name: ceruloplasmin
description: A protein that is a translation product of the human CP gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

name: C-reactive protein
description: A protein that is a translation product of the human CRP gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

name: deoxyribonuclease-1
description: A protein that is a translation product of the human DNASE1 gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

name: erythropoietin
description: A protein that is a translation product of the human EPO gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

name: glial cell line-derived neurotrophic factor
description: A protein that is a translation product of the human GDNF gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

name: beta-globin
description: A hemoglobin subunit that is a translation product of the human HBB gene, a 1:1 ortholog thereof, or pro-orthologs thereof.

name: haptoglobin
description: A protein that is a translation product of the human HP gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

name: parathyroid hormone
description: A protein that is a translation product of the human PTH gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

name: ribonuclease T2
description: A protein that is a translation product of the human RNASET2 gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

name: serotransferrin
description: A protein that is a translation product of the human TF gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

name: transthyretin
description: A protein that is a translation product of the human TTR gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

name: DNA ligase
description: A protein that is a translation product of the Escherichia coli K-12 ligA gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

name: T cell receptor co-receptor CD8
description: A protein-containing complex that is a membrane-bound heterodimeric co-receptor for MHC class-I antigen/T-cell receptor interaction.

name: guanyl-specific ribonuclease T1
description: A protein that is a translation product of the Aspergillus oryzae RIB40 rntA gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

name: nuclease S1
description: A protein that is a translation product of the Aspergillus oryzae RIB40 nucS gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

name: ribonuclease U2
description: A protein that is a translation product of the Ustilago sphaerogena RNU2 gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.

name: ribonuclease V1 (cobra)
description: A protein with ribonuclease activity that is a constituent of cobra venom.

name: ribonuclease CL3 (chicken)
description: A protein with ribonuclease activity that is purified from chicken liver.

name: cytosolic creatine kinase complex, MB-type
description: A cytosolic creatine kinase complex that is a heterodimer of a B-type subunit and an M-type subunit.

name: creatine kinase
description: A protein that contains a single ATP:guanido phosphotransferase N-terminal domain (Pfam:PF02807) followed by a single ATP:guanido phosphotransferase C-terminal catalytic domain (Pfam:PF00217).

name: alanine aminotransferase
description: A protein that is a translation product of the human GPT or GPT2 genes, 1:1 orthologs thereof, or a semi-ortholog thereof.

name: lactate dehydrogenase complex
description: A protein-containing complex that is composed of four subunits of L-lactate dehydrogenase, cytoplasmic.

name: alkaline phosphatase (human)
description: A protein that is a translation product of any of the following alkaline phosphatase genes in human: ALPG (encoding the germinal form; GCAP), ALPP (encoding the placental form; PLAP), ALPI (encoding the intestinal form; IAP), and ALPL (encoding the tissue non-specific form; TNAP).

name: aspartate aminotransferase (human)
description: A protein that is a translation product of any of the following genes in human: GOT1/GOT2.

name: hemoglobin A1c
description: A hemoglobin complex that is composed of at least one beta-N-1-deoxy fructosyl hemoglobin subunit, in which the glycan is attached to the N-terminal valine (after initiator methionine removal) of one or both beta subunits.

name: obsolete molecular label role
description: A reagent role inhering in a molecular entity intended to associate with some molecular target to serve as a proxy for the presence, abundance, or location of this target in a detection of molecular label assay.

name: obsolete molecular label
description: A molecular reagent intended to associate with some molecular target to serve as a proxy for the presence, abundance, or location of this target in a detection of molecular label assay

name: region
description: A sequence_feature with an extent greater than zero. A nucleotide region is composed of bases and a polypeptide region is composed of amino acids.

name: polypeptide
description: A sequence of amino acids linked by peptide bonds which may lack appreciable tertiary structure and may not be liable to irreversible denaturation.

name: supercontig
description: One or more contigs that have been ordered and oriented using end-read information. Contains gaps that are filled with N's.

name: contig
description: A contiguous sequence derived from sequence assembly. Has no gaps, but may contain N's from unavailable bases.

name: miRNA
description: Small, ~22-nt, RNA molecule that is the endogenous transcript of a miRNA gene (or the product of other non coding RNA genes. Micro RNAs are produced from precursor molecules (SO:0000647) that can form local hairpin structures, which ordinarily are processed (usually via the Dicer pathway) such that a single miRNA molecule accumulates from one arm of a hairpin precursor molecule. Micro RNAs may trigger the cleavage of their target molecules or act as translational repressors.

name: sequence_assembly
description: A sequence of nucleotides that has been algorithmically derived from an alignment of two or more different sequences.

name: circular
description: A quality of a nucleotide polymer that has no terminal nucleotide residues.

name: assembly
description: A region of the genome of known length that is composed by ordering and aligning two or more different regions.

name: experimental_feature
description: A region which is the result of some arbitrary experimental procedure. The procedure may be carried out with biological material or inside a computer.

name: uterine cervix
description: Lower, narrow portion of the uterus where it joins with the top end of the vagina.

name: pituitary gland
description: The pituitary gland is an endocrine gland that secretes hormones that regulate many other glands. An endocrine gland located ventral to the diencephalon and derived from mixed neuroectodermal and non neuroectodermal origin.

name: lymph node
description: Any of the rounded masses of lymphoid tissue that are surrounded by a capsule of connective tissue, are distributed along the lymphatic vessels, and contain numerous lymphocytes which filter the flow of lymph.

name: urethra
description: the fibromuscular tubular canal through which urine is discharged from the bladder to the exterior via the external urinary meatus; in males, the urethra is joined by the ejaculatory ducts and serves as a passageway for semen during ejaculation, as well as a canal for urine during voiding; in females, the urethra is shorter and emerges above the vaginal opening

name: life cycle stage
description: A spatiotemporal region encompassing some part of the life cycle of an organism.

name: mouth
description: The proximal portion of the digestive tract, containing the oral cavity and bounded by the oral opening. In vertebrates, this extends to the pharynx and includes gums, lips, tongue and parts of the palate. Typically also includes the teeth, except where these occur elsewhere (e.g. pharyngeal jaws) or protrude from the mouth (tusks).

name: amniotic fluid
description: Amniotic fluid is a bodily fluid consisting of watery liquid surrounding and cushioning a growing fetus within the amnion. It allows the fetus to move freely without the walls of the uterus being too tight against its body. Buoyancy is also provided. The composition of the fluid changes over the course of gestation. Initially, amniotic fluid is similar to maternal plasma, mainly water with electrolytes. As the fetus develops, proteins, carbohydrates, lipids, phospholipids originating from the lungs, fetal cells, and urea are deposited in the fluid.

name: blood
description: A fluid that is composed of blood plasma and erythrocytes.

name: breast
description: The upper ventral region of the torso of an organism.

name: cervical mucus
description: A substance produced by the cervix and endocervical glands. Thick acidic mucus that blocks the cervical os after mestruation. This 'infertile' mucus blocks spermatozoa from entering the uterus.

name: throat
description: In anatomy, the throat is the anterior part of the neck, in front of the vertebral column. It consists of the pharynx and larynx. An important feature of the throat is the epiglottis, a flap which separates the esophagus from the trachea and prevents inhalation of food or drink. The throat contains various blood vessels, various pharyngeal muscles, the trachea (windpipe) and the esophagus. The hyoid bone and the clavicle are the only bones located in the throat of mammals. It is sometimes considered a synonym for fauces..

name: renal medulla
description: the inner portion of the kidney consisting of the renal pyramids

name: organism substance
description: Material anatomical entity in a gaseous, liquid, semisolid or solid state; produced by anatomical structures or derived from inhaled and ingested substances that have been modified by anatomical structures as they pass through the body.

name: material anatomical entity
description: Anatomical entity that has mass.

name: testis
description: A gonad of a male animal. A gonad produces and releases sperm.

name: anatomical cluster
description: Anatomical group that has its parts adjacent to one another.

name: tissue
description: Multicellular anatomical structure that consists of many cells of one or a few types, arranged in an extracellular matrix such that their long-range organisation is at least partly a repetition of their short-range organisation.

name: multi-tissue structure
description: Anatomical structure that has as its parts two or more portions of tissue of at least two different types and which through specific morphogenetic processes forms a single distinct structural unit demarcated by bona-fide boundaries from other distinct structural units of different types.

name: epithelium
description: Portion of tissue, that consists of one or more layers of epithelial cells connected to each other by cell junctions and which is underlain by a basal lamina. Examples: simple squamous epithelium, glandular cuboidal epithelium, transitional epithelium, myoepithelium.

name: stomach
description: An expanded region of the vertebrate alimentary tract that serves as a food storage compartment and digestive organ. A stomach is lined, in whole or in part by a glandular epithelium.

name: aorta
description: The main trunk of the systemic arterial system that carries blood from the heart to all the organs and other structures of the body, bringing oxygenated blood to all parts of the body in the systemic circulation

name: heart
description: A myogenic muscular circulatory organ found in the vertebrate cardiovascular system composed of chambers of cardiac muscle. It is the primary circulatory organ.

name: brain
description: The brain is the center of the nervous system in all vertebrate, and most invertebrate, animals. Some primitive animals such as jellyfish and starfish have a decentralized nervous system without a brain, while sponges lack any nervous system at all. In vertebrates, the brain is located in the head, protected by the skull and close to the primary sensory apparatus of vision, hearing, balance, taste, and smell.

name: cerebral cortex
description: The thin layer of gray matter on the surface of the cerebral hemisphere that develops from the telencephalon. It consists of the neocortex (6 layered cortex or isocortex), the hippocampal formation and the olfactory cortex.

name: eye
description: An organ that detects light.

name: ovary
description: the gonad of a female organism which contains germ cells

name: uterus
description: the female muscular organ of gestation in which the developing embryo or fetus is nourished until birth

name: vagina
description: A fibromuscular tubular tract leading from the uterus to the exterior of the body in female placental mammals and marsupials, or to the cloaca in female birds, monotremes, and some reptiles.

name: respiratory system
description: Functional system which consists of structures involved in respiration.

name: adipose tissue
description: Portion of connective tissue composed of adipocytes enmeshed in areolar tissue

name: strand of hair
description: A filament, mostly protein, that grows from follicles found in the dermis.

name: rectum
description: the terminal portion of the intestinal tube, terminating with the anus

name: pleural fluid
description: Transudate contained in the pleural cavity.

name: urine
description: Excretion that is the output of a kidney

name: sweat
description: Secretion produced by a sweat gland.

name: synovial fluid
description: Joint fluid is a transudate of plasma that is actively secreted by synovial cells.

name: skeletal muscle tissue
description: Muscle tissue that consists primarily of skeletal muscle fibers.

name: colon
description: Last portion of the large intestine before it becomes the rectum.

name: sigmoid colon
description: The part of the large intestine that is closest to the rectum and anus. It forms a loop that averages about 40 cm. in length, and normally lies within the pelvis, but on account of its freedom of movement it is liable to be displaced into the abdominal cavity.

name: cortex of kidney
description: Outer cortical portion of the kidney, between the renal capsule and the renal medulla.

name: urinary bladder
description: distensible musculomembranous organ situated in the anterior part of the pelvic cavity in which urine collects before excretion.

name: pancreas
description: An endoderm derived structure that produces precursors of digestive enzymes and blood glucose regulating enzymes.

name: peritoneal fluid
description: Transudate contained in the peritoneal cavity.

name: tibial nerve
description: The tibial nerve is a branch of the sciatic nerve. The tibial nerve passes through the popliteal fossa to pass below the arch of soleus. In the popliteal fossa the nerve gives off branches to gastrocnemius, popliteus, soleus and plantaris muscles, an articular branch to the knee joint, and a cutaneous branch that will become the sural nerve. The sural nerve is joined by fibres from the common peroneal nerve and runs down the calf to supply the lateral side of the foot. Below the soleus muscle the nerve lies close to the tibia and supplies the tibialis posterior, the flexor digitorum longus and the flexor hallucis longus. The nerve passes into the foot running posterior to the medial malleolus. Here it is bound down by the flexor retinaculum in company with the posterior tibial artery..

name: cerebrospinal fluid
description: A clear, colorless, bodily fluid, that occupies the subarachnoid space and the ventricular system around and inside the brain and spinal cord.

name: upper respiratory tract
description: The segment of the respiratory tract that starts proximally with the nose and ends distally with the cricoid cartilage, before continuing to the trachea.

name: lower respiratory tract
description: The segment of the respiratory tract that starts proximally with the trachea and includes all distal structures including the lungs

name: cheek
description: A fleshy subdivision of one side of the face bounded by an eye, ear and the nose.

name: coronary artery
description: An artery that supplies the myocardium.

name: vein
description: Any of the tubular branching vessels that carry blood from the capillaries toward the heart.

name: tongue
description: A muscular organ in the floor of the mouth.

name: nasopharynx
description: the section of the pharynx that lies above the soft palate

name: oropharynx
description: the portion of the pharynx that lies between the soft palate and the upper edge of the epiglottis

name: vitreous humor
description: A transparent, semigelatinous substance that fills the cavity behind the crystalline lens of the eye and in front of the retina

name: nasal cavity mucosa
description: The mucous membrane that lines the nasal cavity.

name: minor salivary gland
description: One of the smaller, largely mucus-secreting, exocrine glands of the oral cavity, consisting of the labial, buccal, molar, lingual, and palatine glands.

name: saliva
description: A fluid produced in the oral cavity by salivary glands, typically used in predigestion, but also in other functions.

name: caudate nucleus
description: Subcortical nucleus of telecephalic origin consisting of an elongated gray mass lying lateral to and bordering the lateral ventricle. It is divided into a head, body and tail in some species.

name: putamen
description: Subcortical nucleus of telencephalic , which together with the caudate nucleus, forms the striatum. The putamen lies lateral to the internal capsule and medial to the external medullary lamina, and is separated from the caudate nucleus by the fibers of the internal capsule for most of its length, except at its anterior portion.

name: milk
description: An emulsion of fat globules within a fluid that is secreted by the mammary gland during lactation.

name: semen
description: Organism substance that is composed of sperm cells suspended in seminal fluid.

name: bile
description: vital aqueous secretion of the liver that is formed by hepatocytes and modified down stream by absorptive and secretory properties of the bile duct epithelium.

name: placenta
description: organ of metabolic interchange between fetus and mother, partly of embryonic origin and partly of maternal origin. The fetal portion of the placenta is known as the villous chorion. The maternal portion is known as the decidua basalis. The two portions are held together by anchoring villi that are anchored to the decidua basalis by the cytotrophoblastic shell.

name: feces
description: Portion of semisolid bodily waste discharged through the anus

name: areola
description: Subdivision of breast which consists of skin, connective tissue and smooth muscle bundle and modified sebaceous glands and which surrounds the nipple.

name: cerebellum
description: Part of the metencephalon that lies in the posterior cranial fossa behind the brain stem. It is concerned with the coordination of movement. A large dorsally projecting part of the brain concerned especially with the coordination of muscles and the maintenance of bodily equilibrium, situated between the brain stem and the back of the cerebrum , and formed in humans of two lateral lobes and a median lobe. Brain structure derived from the anterior hindbrain, and perhaps including posterior midbrain. The cerebellum plays a role in somatic motor function, the control of muscle tone, and balance.

name: thyroid gland
description: A two-lobed endocrine gland found in all vertebrates, located in front of and on either side of the trachea in humans, and producing various hormones, such as triiodothyronine and calcitonin.

name: lung
description: Respiration organ that develops as an outpocketing of the esophagus.

name: dermis
description: The dermis is a layer of skin between the epidermis (with which it makes up the skin) and subcutaneous tissues, and is composed of two layers, the papillary and reticular dermis.

name: hypodermis
description: Lowermost layer of the integumentary system in vertebrates. Types of cells that are found in the hypodermis are fibroblasts, adipose cells, and macrophages. It is derived from the mesoderm, but unlike the dermis, it is not derived from the dermatome region of the mesoderm. The hypodermis is used mainly for fat storage.

name: skin of body
description: The organ covering the body that consists of the dermis and epidermis.

name: spleen
description: the organ that functions to filter blood and to store red corpuscles and platelets

name: liver
description: An exocrine gland which secretes bile and functions in metabolism of protein and carbohydrate and fat, synthesizes substances involved in the clotting of the blood, synthesizes vitamin A, detoxifies poisonous substances, stores glycogen, and breaks down worn-out erythrocytes.

name: ileum
description: the portion of the small intestine that extends from the jejunum to the colon

name: integument
description: The dermis, epidermis and hypodermis.

name: peritoneum
description: A serous membrane that lines the peritoneal cavity.

name: prostate gland
description: The prostate gland is a partly muscular, partly glandular body that is situated near the base of the mammalian male urethra and secretes an alkaline viscid fluid which is a major constituent of the ejaculatory fluid.

name: adrenal gland
description: Either of a pair of complex endocrine organs near the anterior medial border of the kidney consisting of a mesodermal cortex that produces glucocorticoid, mineralocorticoid, and androgenic hormones and an ectodermal medulla that produces epinephrine and norepinephrine.

name: bone marrow
description: the soft tissue that fills the cavities of bones

name: pericardial fluid
description: Transudate contained in the pericardial cavity.

name: tail
description: An external caudal extension of the body. In chordates, the tail is post-anal, in other animals the anus ends in the tail

name: esophagus mucosa
description: A mucosa that is part of a esophagus.

name: left cerebral hemisphere
description: A cerebral hemisphere that is in the left side of a brain.

name: right cerebral hemisphere
description: A cerebral hemisphere that is in the right side of a brain.

name: trachea
description: The trachea is the portion of the airway that attaches to the bronchi as it branches.

name: omentum
description: A fold of peritoneum originating at the stomach and supporting the viscera.

name: esophagus muscularis mucosa
description: A muscularis mucosa that is part of a esophagus.

name: mucosa of nasopharynx
description: A mucosa that is part of a nasopharynx.

name: mucosa of oropharynx
description: A mucosa that is part of a oropharynx.

name: middle nasal concha
description: The medial surface of the labyrinth of ethmoid consists of a thin lamella, which descends from the under surface of the cribriform plate, and ends below in a free, convoluted margin, the middle nasal concha. It is rough, and marked above by numerous grooves, directed nearly vertically downward from the cribriform plate; they lodge branches of the olfactory nerves, which are distributed to the mucous membrane covering the superior nasal concha.

name: bodily fluid
description: Liquid components of living organisms. includes fluids that are excreted or secreted from the body as well as body water that normally is not.

name: respiratory system fluid/secretion
description: A portion of organism substance that secreted_by a respiratory system.

name: atrium auricular region
description: A small conical pouch projections located on the upper anterior portion of each atrium of the heart.

name: chorionic villus
description: One of the minute vascular projections of the fetal chorion that combines with maternal uterine tissue to form the placenta.

name: meconium
description: A dark greenish mass that accumulates in the bowel during fetal life and is discharged shortly after birth.

name: sputum
description: Matter ejected from the lungs, bronchi, and trachea, through the mouth.

name: tibial artery
description: The anterior and posterior arteries created at the bifurcation of the popliteal artery. The anterior tibial artery begins at the lower border of the popliteus muscle and lies along the tibia at the distal part of the leg to surface superficially anterior to the ankle joint. Its branches are distributed throughout the leg, ankle, and pes. The posterior tibial artery begins at the lower border of the popliteus muscle, lies behind the tibia in the lower part of its course, and is found situated between the medial malleolus and the medial process of the calcaneal tuberosity. Its branches are distributed throughout the leg and foot.

name: esophagogastric junction
description: The junction between the esophagus and the stomach epithelium

name: omental fat pad
description: encapsulated adipose tissue associated with the fold of peritoneal tissue that extends from the stomach to the posterior abdominal wall after associating with the transverse colon

name: umbilical cord blood
description: blood that remains in the placenta and in the attached umbilical cord after childbirth.

name: arterial blood
description: A blood that is part of a artery.

name: venous blood
description: A blood that is part of a vein.

name: capillary blood
description: A blood that is part of a capillary.

name: suprapubic skin
description: Area of skin in the hypoastric region of the abdomen.

name: anterior nasal wall
description: Paired, vertical, and relatively straight plates that form the anterior limit of the nasal capsule.

name: length unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the distance between two points.

name: mass unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the amount of matter/energy of a physical object.

name: time unit
description: A unit which is a standard measure of the dimension in which events occur in sequence.

name: vaccine
description: A vaccine is a processed material with the function that when administered, it prevents or ameliorates a disorder in a target organism by inducing or modifying adaptive immune responses specific to the antigens in the vaccine.

name: vaccination
description: a process of administering substance in vivo that involves in adding a vaccine into a host (e.g., human) in vivo with the intent to invoke a protective or therapeutic adaptive immune response.
